commit_message:
Fix missing cronie package in RHEL-based image builds

In RHEL-based distros, cron is provided by the cronie package. This package is
missing from the amphora built images.

This patch maps the cron package to cronie for distros in the Red Hat family.

Change-Id: I6fb7889de90e8e5354c1e6ce2c95ec0199ce90e3
Story: 2008351
Task: 41253
(cherry picked from commit 6aa23358eb2f4df412e010fd1fbb9e35ee2e1522)

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I9028875399b54ab961ae46ca13f9cf6e6fc7ad89

commit_message:
Add support of vnic_type to Profile

This patch allow to define vnic_type direct and macvtap in profile,
Default network port type is normal for general vm but sriov instance
need vnic_type "direct or macvtap".

Change-Id: Iecd2e028837a3ad15145ad21f8167007ce7a0741

commit_message:
Check if config param exists before using it

When using the cluster.stop_timeout_before_update config parameter,
check if it exists before using it.  That parameter is optional and
should not error if it is not specified.

Change-Id: Ic6b3172736f5cd348e391371f79defa1aeb790e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 10:53:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration from the HA to non-HA routers

In case if during switching HA router to be down, there will be any
failure, router_info will be stored in L3 agent's cache as HaRouter.
In case when next update on the router is migration to non-HA router
this is wrong class and it causes other issues, e.g. with
remove_vip_by_ip_address() which is correct only for HA routers.

This patch fixes that issue by adding check of the router's ha and
distributed flags and update local cache with new router_info class
in case if at least one of those flags don't match.

Change-Id: Ib0d3a501f88c149baea7d715c7cfe5811bc85e4f
Closes-Bug: #1892846
(cherry picked from commit 489e0ead7297e3b17ca2bf8c4bea9701ad14a939)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix migration from the HA to non-HA routers

In case if during switching HA router to be down, there will be any
failure, router_info will be stored in L3 agent's cache as HaRouter.
In case when next update on the router is migration to non-HA router
this is wrong class and it causes other issues, e.g. with
remove_vip_by_ip_address() which is correct only for HA routers.

This patch fixes that issue by adding check of the router's ha and
distributed flags and update local cache with new router_info class
in case if at least one of those flags don't match.

Change-Id: Ib0d3a501f88c149baea7d715c7cfe5811bc85e4f
Closes-Bug: #1892846
(cherry picked from commit 489e0ead7297e3b17ca2bf8c4bea9701ad14a939)

commit_message:
Fix migration from the HA to non-HA routers

In case if during switching HA router to be down, there will be any
failure, router_info will be stored in L3 agent's cache as HaRouter.
In case when next update on the router is migration to non-HA router
this is wrong class and it causes other issues, e.g. with
remove_vip_by_ip_address() which is correct only for HA routers.

This patch fixes that issue by adding check of the router's ha and
distributed flags and update local cache with new router_info class
in case if at least one of those flags don't match.

Change-Id: Ib0d3a501f88c149baea7d715c7cfe5811bc85e4f
Closes-Bug: #1892846
(cherry picked from commit 489e0ead7297e3b17ca2bf8c4bea9701ad14a939)

Add flavor_id property to Load-Balancing Policy

This commit will add flavor_id property to Load-Balancing Policy
to allow specify octavia loadbalancer flavor.
https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/admin/flavors.html

commit_message:
Updates nic-config conversion guidelines

Adds additional parameters to the Heat parameters
to Ansible vars Mapping table

commit_message:
Create a container for Unbound DNS resolver

This patch sets up TripleO to create a container for the Unbound
DNS resolver. This will be used with Designate deployments to
provide DNS resolver services to the deployment and neutron.

Change-Id: Ifccee277393cc9ab095d1785216d3dacfbf3c5ce

commit_message:
Update ephemeral image build script path

Airshipctl uses the build_images.sh script to build the ephemeral node's
ISO image; however, this repository has not been updated. This change
updates the path of the script to ensure that openstack-helm-deployments
uses the same image build process as airshipctl.

Change-Id: I71746f94965808d589ee9e61400a80915a9ffa99
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
Switch gnocchi-statsd HC to healthcheck_port

The currently used healthcheck_listen does not work for UDP protocol
since it was switched from ss usage to lsof usage and statsd is listening
on UDP:8125.

Close-Bug: #1907485
Change-Id: I037f6bdd470f521b73bdfadb45f91b31321b0b01

commit_message:
Add options to choose endpoints and SSL verification

In case of usage of self-signed SSL certificates for public endpoints,
you will get stuck with senlin usage. So in case of such scenario it's
essential to either choose endpoint type or disable SSL verification.
Both of these options are implemented in most services and are expected.

Change-Id: Ifa475ff146af8b49a762218ff244f0ff0fee9ac0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-11 05:38:03.000000000', 'message': "Handle errors on system upgrade

Using 'wait' will not return error if any of the
child background process fails. This results in
unexpected behavior of triggering upgrade run
eventhough system upgrade failed. Observed this
issue during the integration of NFV's NIC partitioning
feature, in which system upgrade hangs on SR-IOV
cleanup step.

Used `wait $PID` to handle the states of all child
processes and wait for all to complete. Exit with error
if anyone of the childs exited with error.

Change-Id: I084f3b974e37c9f5a4d720747e408645deb50995
"}, {'created': '2021-01-12 10:43:20.000000000', 'message': "Handle errors on system upgrade

Using 'wait' will not return error if any of the
child background process fails. This results in
unexpected behavior of triggering upgrade run
eventhough system upgrade failed. Observed this
issue during the integration of NFV's NIC partitioning
feature, in which system upgrade hangs on SR-IOV
cleanup step.

Used `wait $PID` to handle the states of all child
processes and wait for all to complete. Exit with error
if anyone of the childs exited with error.

Change-Id: I084f3b974e37c9f5a4d720747e408645deb50995
"}]
commit_message:
Handle errors on system upgrade

Using 'wait' will not return error if any of the
child background process fails. This results in
unexpected behavior of triggering upgrade run
eventhough system upgrade failed. Observed this
issue during the integration of NFV's NIC partitioning
feature, in which system upgrade hangs on SR-IOV
cleanup step.

Used `wait $PID` to handle the states of all child
processes and wait for all to complete. Exit with error
if anyone of the childs exited with error.

Change-Id: I084f3b974e37c9f5a4d720747e408645deb50995

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-15 16:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --limit with commas

Kayobe allows specifying a --limit argument, which is passed through to
Ansible. In some cases we wish to add an intersection with a group. This
allows us to reuse playbooks for the seed, overcloud etc.

For example, the lvm.yml playbook specifies a host list of
seed-hypervisor:seed:overcloud. When executed as part of a kayobe
overcloud host configure command, Kayobe passes a limit of overcloud. If
the user specifies a --limit argument, this gets intersected with the
overcloud limit: host1:&overcloud.

The problem happens if the user specifies multiple parts to the host
pattern in their limit using a comma, e.g. host1,host2. This results in
host1,host2:&overcloud. Ansible ignores the colon, and treats this as
host1 or host2:&overcloud.

The solution is to use a comma to join the patterns if the user has used
a comma: host1:host2:&overcloud

Change-Id: Ibe42fa372c6fa0c539d2c2b0e238601286dc213d
Story: 2008255
Task: 41111
'}, {'created': '2021-01-08 15:08:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --limit with commas

Kayobe allows specifying a --limit argument, which is passed through to
Ansible. In some cases we wish to add an intersection with a group. This
allows us to reuse playbooks for the seed, overcloud etc.

For example, the lvm.yml playbook specifies a host list of
seed-hypervisor:seed:overcloud. When executed as part of a kayobe
overcloud host configure command, Kayobe passes a limit of overcloud. If
the user specifies a --limit argument, this gets intersected with the
overcloud limit: host1:&overcloud.

The problem happens if the user specifies multiple parts to the host
pattern in their limit using a comma, e.g. host1,host2. This results in
host1,host2:&overcloud. Ansible ignores the colon, and treats this as
host1 or host2:&overcloud.

The solution is to use a comma to join the patterns if the user has used
a comma: host1,host2,&overcloud

Change-Id: Ibe42fa372c6fa0c539d2c2b0e238601286dc213d
Story: 2008255
Task: 41111
'}]
commit_message:
Fix --limit with commas

Kayobe allows specifying a --limit argument, which is passed through to
Ansible. In some cases we wish to add an intersection with a group. This
allows us to reuse playbooks for the seed, overcloud etc.

For example, the lvm.yml playbook specifies a host list of
seed-hypervisor:seed:overcloud. When executed as part of a kayobe
overcloud host configure command, Kayobe passes a limit of overcloud. If
the user specifies a --limit argument, this gets intersected with the
overcloud limit: host1:&overcloud.

The problem happens if the user specifies multiple parts to the host
pattern in their limit using a comma, e.g. host1,host2. This results in
host1,host2:&overcloud. Ansible ignores the colon, and treats this as
host1 or host2:&overcloud.

The solution is to use a comma to join the patterns if the user has used
a comma: host1,host2,&overcloud

Change-Id: Ibe42fa372c6fa0c539d2c2b0e238601286dc213d
Story: 2008255
Task: 41111

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

commit_message:
Handle listener not found during loadbalancer status update

If a call to update loadbalancer status cannot find the
specified listener, the API server will throw an exception:

"Error while updating the load balancer status: 'NoneType'
 object has no attribute 'update'"

Change ListenerRepository.update() to check the DB query
returned a record, and if not, raise a NotFound exception
back to the caller.

Change-Id: I6693be3e2d2f0e34f19f07f55b0429f8fda317b2
Task: 41108
Story: 2008254
(cherry picked from commit 17ae2625da0487b7398b927e4e67a713b61569d1)

I'm actually not sure if this patch should be backported and would like to see feedback from the stable team. The fix is changing the behavior in an incompatible way, but on the other hand unless I'm mistaken it only affects the initial deployment, and it doesn't make sense for anyone to be relying on the previous, broken behaviour."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-01-14 13:27:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> I'm actually not sure if this patch should be backported and would like to see feedback from the stable team. The fix is changing the behavior in an incompatible way, but on the other hand unless I'm mistaken it only affects the initial deployment, and it doesn't make sense for anyone to be relying on the previous, broken behaviour.

Good question. That is definitely a concern with a stable backport. I agree though, since this is really only going to impact initial deployment, I think in this case it is safe to backport it.

It's also one of those areas where it is actually fixing an issue, so the choice is between strictly following stable guidelines, and leaving things broken, or backporting and introducing a potential operator concern.

It probably would have been better if this included a release note or some type of docs update. But overall, I think this looks safe enough and addresses an issue, so worth getting backported."}]

commit_message:
fix database sync always get the wrong  value

we create a default pool  when exec database sync, and get the
default_pool_id from designate.conf, but we did not register this
opt before using  it, so we always get the default value which is
wrong

Change-Id: I500c932a502db24332aad95c54713b7056bc1df4
Closes-Bug: 1881277
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1855877
(cherry picked from commit 609437e73deff55e9f5548538f093d01f0addd1b)

commit_message:
Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects

A reference to the ovsdbapp Connection object is stored on the the
API impl class and it is causing the object to stick around and
its pipe fds to never close. Ultimately, python-ovs's call to
select() is limited to 1024 file descriptors and will eventually
error out. This deletes the connection and api objects explicitly
when we are done with them.

Conflicts:
    ovn_octavia_provider/driver.py
    ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py
    ovn_octavia_provider/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py

Change-Id: I97b27eaa293fb161724d34da88b4398f8b590c33
Co-authored-by: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1894136
(cherry picked from commit 5b0715d96700d1c288f601b3ecb2cad507c2c134)

commit_message:
Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects

A reference to the ovsdbapp Connection object is stored on the the
API impl class and it is causing the object to stick around and
its pipe fds to never close. Ultimately, python-ovs's call to
select() is limited to 1024 file descriptors and will eventually
error out. This deletes the connection and api objects explicitly
when we are done with them.

Change-Id: I97b27eaa293fb161724d34da88b4398f8b590c33
Co-authored-by: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1894136
(cherry picked from commit 5b0715d96700d1c288f601b3ecb2cad507c2c134)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 18:20:36.000000000', 'message': 'Retry status updates to Octavia

When the OVN Octavia Provider driver calls into
octavia-lib to update the status of a loadbalancer,
it might fail. This can happen if a resource associated
with the loadbalancer was not found, for example, if
it's DB transaction was in-flight.

A side-effect is the resource can become "stuck":

$ openstack loadbalancer listener delete $ID
Load Balancer $ID is immutable and cannot be updated.

The provider driver needs to retry the operation,
typically even the very next call succeeds.

Conflicts:
    ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py

Change-Id: Ia4460dd0ae22949920f3f304b315e3c3f32f89c0
Closes-bug: #1900763
(cherry picked from commit 723ca5afeea3fa17e968d9c37220a4ff5a977d45)
'}, {'created': '2020-12-04 19:19:35.000000000', 'message': 'Retry status updates to Octavia

When the OVN Octavia Provider driver calls into
octavia-lib to update the status of a loadbalancer,
it might fail. This can happen if a resource associated
with the loadbalancer was not found, for example, if
it's DB transaction was in-flight.

A side-effect is the resource can become "stuck":

$ openstack loadbalancer listener delete $ID
Load Balancer $ID is immutable and cannot be updated.

The provider driver needs to retry the operation,
typically even the very next call succeeds.

Also had to fix a minor pep8 issue in test_checks.py

Conflicts:
    ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py

Change-Id: Ia4460dd0ae22949920f3f304b315e3c3f32f89c0
Closes-bug: #1900763
(cherry picked from commit 723ca5afeea3fa17e968d9c37220a4ff5a977d45)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry status updates to Octavia

When the OVN Octavia Provider driver calls into
octavia-lib to update the status of a loadbalancer,
it might fail. This can happen if a resource associated
with the loadbalancer was not found, for example, if
it's DB transaction was in-flight.

A side-effect is the resource can become "stuck":

$ openstack loadbalancer listener delete $ID
Load Balancer $ID is immutable and cannot be updated.

The provider driver needs to retry the operation,
typically even the very next call succeeds.

Also had to fix a minor pep8 issue in test_checks.py

Conflicts:
    ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py

Change-Id: Ia4460dd0ae22949920f3f304b315e3c3f32f89c0
Closes-bug: #1900763
(cherry picked from commit 723ca5afeea3fa17e968d9c37220a4ff5a977d45)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 19:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Change-Id: I741059afad42d0aa1e17b5becd56cbbbb0003c82
Related-Bug: #1863595
(cherry picked from commit d3826e9ec3c0532396c5c795e5764b24e63ddfed)
'}]
commit_message:
Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Change-Id: I741059afad42d0aa1e17b5becd56cbbbb0003c82
Related-Bug: #1863595
(cherry picked from commit d3826e9ec3c0532396c5c795e5764b24e63ddfed)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I4b54c27a99a095c7712c88b0e8bd59a21d7bc0b4

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

subject: Add doc/requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 15:35:31.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

Notice that pymod2pkg isn't released by the openstack/release team due
to the recent SIG move, however standardization can't hurt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iba51416b8c4544db3983ac0ea1e6ea53d266be7c
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

Notice that pymod2pkg isn't released by the openstack/release team due
to the recent SIG move, however standardization can't hurt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iba51416b8c4544db3983ac0ea1e6ea53d266be7c

Sorry, I've just though about it now, but is that possible to deploy openstack with different local with the mysql database encoding correctly setup ?

The main issue is when you system encoding is set to something (LANG=C) and your database encoding is set to something else (LANG=UTF-8).  But if everything is configured properly (db match os) then this patch would break such env.

So back to my initial question, do we hardcode UTF-8 in the db ourself, is there a way to configure encoding (os, db) in tripleo ?

We may shout ourself in the feet here as there is no way to override that parameter."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-21 13:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-04-24 08:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-05-04 12:57:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Let's add some more information in the commit msg and make an associated lp for future reference."}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-07-28 08:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Fix the unicode error with puppet.

Force the environment variable LANG when we run the puppet command. To
ensure we have a unicode system and prevent unicode error problems. For
example, if we have a unicode entry in database.

Change-Id: Ic7bd6956f869acbee6a253269d4c3972532499e2
Closes-Bug: #1911679
Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ib9ef556d8f63fdba1901717360af4cbd86faa0e7

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ia5b237aa59f1c07165698b0d5edb73287d990305

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Victoria)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: I1c8effc1a76f326ba2bfd6f541c5458ab9148889

subject: NRPE: Allow excluding queues from queue-size checks
messages:
[{'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-08 14:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-08 15:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2020-12-08 17:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2020-12-09 15:54:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Could you please share the output of the command when deployed with the default options? Since there are no func tests related to nrpe, it would be helpful to see the output of a manual test.

OTOH, I think this change is great from the Alerting/Monitoring point of view, but a way to limit the size (number of messages) of a RMQ queue would be helpful for operators to limit how much these unmonitored queues can grow. Probably a new bug should be filed (if it does not exist yet) to address that problem (otherwise, disk resources would grow until host exhaustion).

I'll abstain from scoring the change until CI tests pass. Thank you, though!"}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-10 12:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Could you please share the output of the command when deployed with the default options? Since there are no func tests related to nrpe, it would be helpful to see the output of a manual test.

Note: If anyone wants to replicate my testing, you also need to include changes from here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server/+/765670

In my testing environment (OS bionic/queens + nagios), there's only one queue that has any messages and that is "alarm.all.sample" on the "openstack" vhost. Results:

```
root@juju-d6c9c1-22:~# /usr/local/lib/nagios/plugins/check_rabbitmq_queues.py -c \* \* 1 2 /var/lib/rabbitmq/data/juju-d6c9c1-22_queue_stats.dat
CRITICAL: * in * has 2 messages
root@juju-d6c9c1-22:~# /usr/local/lib/nagios/plugins/check_rabbitmq_queues.py -c \* \* 1 2 -e openstack alarm.all.sample /var/lib/rabbitmq/data/juju-d6c9c1-22_queue_stats.dat
OK
root@juju-d6c9c1-22:~# 
```'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-11 15:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-14 07:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-14 13:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-15 21:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-12-17 13:57:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Looks good, thanks! Just one nitpick.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-17 15:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-17 16:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-12-17 16:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2020-12-17 19:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Can you elaborate more about why these queues are being excluded by default? I would assume that if these queues are growing unbounded that they are still cause for concern and should alert the operator as they have real impacts to the rabbitmq cluster.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-12-18 09:40:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> Can you elaborate more about why these queues are being excluded by default? I would assume that if these queues are growing unbounded that they are still cause for concern and should alert the operator as they have real impacts to the rabbitmq cluster.

My understanding is that there are other issues that deal with the growing queues:

* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1737170
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1908260

The first one contains workaround that sets TTL on notification queues.

My bug/issue was more about these notification queues not contributing to the nagios warnings. However, now that I looked more closely, the workaround in place does not cover all the queues that I exclude by default here.

I see your point that unchecked growing queues is a bad thing. But since these queues were suggested by @Alvaro and he already left for holidays, I'm afraid we'll have to wait for him to provide more info."}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2021-01-04 10:12:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > Can you elaborate more about why these queues are being excluded by default? I would assume that if these queues are growing unbounded that they are still cause for concern and should alert the operator as they have real impacts to the rabbitmq cluster.
> 
> My understanding is that there are other issues that deal with the growing queues:
> 
> * https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1737170
> * https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1908260
> 
> The first one contains workaround that sets TTL on notification queues.
> 
> My bug/issue was more about these notification queues not contributing to the nagios warnings. However, now that I looked more closely, the workaround in place does not cover all the queues that I exclude by default here.
> 
> I see your point that unchecked growing queues is a bad thing. But since these queues were suggested by @Alvaro and he already left for holidays, I'm afraid we'll have to wait for him to provide more info.

Per discussion with Martin, we both agree that the queues shouldn't be excluding by default until there is no automatic mechanism to limit the size of the excluded queues. The new Juju config parameter will allow to exclude monitored queues, but no queues would be set by default (at least, for now).

Some operations teams create croned jobs to purge unconsumed queues, and increase the size thresholds in Nagios to take the unconsumed queues into consideration. This fix will help better filter unconsumed queues, but queue size limitation will be worked on a different bug (shared above by Martin)."}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-01-12 14:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-01-13 08:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-01-14 02:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-14 09:34:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Just one nitpick. Looks good to me otherwise. I'll then be happy to land on smoke tests only once the nitpick has been adressed. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-01-14 10:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-14 10:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Shouldn't it be "single-escaped" instead?'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-14 11:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Clarified offline: there are two possible yaml syntaxes. Single-escape works with only one of these syntaxes whereas double-escape works everywhere.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-14 12:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
NRPE: Allow excluding queues from queue-size checks

Option '-e <vhost>  <queue>' was added to the 'check_rabbitmq_queues.py'
nrpe script to allow excluding selected queues when checking queue
sizes. Corresponding option 'exclude_queues' was added to the
charm config.
By default, following queues are excluded:
 * event.sample
 * notifications_designate.info
 * notifications_designate.error
 * versioned_notifications.info
 * versioned_notifications.error

Closes-Bug: #1811433
Change-Id: I57e297bb4323a3ab98da020bfcb1630889aac6d7

commit_message:
Updates for testing period for 20.01 release

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

Change-Id: I87d7373ec6407dbfd30a93e04146fb122978634d

commit_message:
Add description for the "tag-ports-during-bulk-creation" extension

The 'tag-ports-during-bulk-creation' extension was introduced some time
ago with [1] but we missed info about this API extension in the api-ref
document.
So this patch adds this missing description in the api-ref document.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/700754

Change-Id: I357174ede1dfc93088363da67337a47c8bffd434

This spec proposes to provide the initial design for
Cyborg's Inspur NVMe SSD driver.

Move zuul config file to root folder

Moving .zuul.d/project.yaml to .zuul.yaml as it is the only file in
that folder and to look similar to other oslo repos.

commit_message:
Add doc of ETSI VNF Error-handling

Usage guide for ETSI NFV-SOL VNF Error-handling
is added in user docs.
This patch describes the procedure for rollback
operation as an error-handling operation.

Change-Id: I444e57daf1bf361741b91285021442b13575ea73

commit_message:
Fix amphorav2 bytes error

Fix Object of type 'bytes' is not JSON serializable
error while writing barbican tls data to persistence database.
Also fix _encrypt_listener_dict to encrypt dicts properly:
error - data must be bytes (HTTP 500)

Story: 2007877
Task: 40245

Change-Id: If69b5973e2a82c8e8d323a89eefb426a3986cd8f
(cherry picked from commit 02dc98814b515ad4ac19f71b5fdbe0dc5f045098)

subject: Handle listener not found during loadbalancer status update
messages: [{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-12-02 16:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-12-03 14:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-01-14 09:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-02 16:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'Handle listener not found during loadbalancer status update

If a call to update loadbalancer status cannot find the
specified listener, the API server will throw an exception:

"Error while updating the load balancer status: 'NoneType'
 object has no attribute 'update'"

Change ListenerRepository.update() to check the DB query
returned a record, and if not, raise a NotFound exception
back to the caller.

Change-Id: I6693be3e2d2f0e34f19f07f55b0429f8fda317b2
Task: 41108
Story: 2008254
(cherry picked from commit 17ae2625da0487b7398b927e4e67a713b61569d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle listener not found during loadbalancer status update

If a call to update loadbalancer status cannot find the
specified listener, the API server will throw an exception:

"Error while updating the load balancer status: 'NoneType'
 object has no attribute 'update'"

Change ListenerRepository.update() to check the DB query
returned a record, and if not, raise a NotFound exception
back to the caller.

Change-Id: I6693be3e2d2f0e34f19f07f55b0429f8fda317b2
Task: 41108
Story: 2008254
(cherry picked from commit 17ae2625da0487b7398b927e4e67a713b61569d1)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Victoria)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ibf9b20b993ab59b64bd4c954cfcd34f14e0e078c

commit_message:
Update requirements and lower-constraints

Changes prompted by the new pip resolver doing stricter dependency
checking:
- req, lc: cinder to 17.0.0 (victoria official release)
- lc: os-brick: 2.7.0 -> 4.0.1 (victoria official release)
- lc: stevedore: 1.20.0 -> 1.31.0 (version in victoria cinder l-c)
- update test-req to match cinder stable/victoria versions
- added some indirect dependencies to test-requirements.txt to help
  speed up dependency resolution

This patch is picking up an updated flake8 that is more strict
about import order checking, so we add a per-file-ignore config
option to tox.ini to turn off E402 detection for the affected
files.  See comment in cinderlib/cinder.py for details.  NOTE:
per-file-ignores requires flake8>=3.7.0, but we don't specify
that here because the flake8 version is controlled by hacking.

Change-Id: I6e7fb6724bb29078b2fa70a38f37238c356e6f48

commit_message:
Fix amphorav2 bytes error

Fix Object of type 'bytes' is not JSON serializable
error while writing barbican tls data to persistence database.
Also fix _encrypt_listener_dict to encrypt dicts properly:
error - data must be bytes (HTTP 500)

Story: 2007877
Task: 40245

Change-Id: If69b5973e2a82c8e8d323a89eefb426a3986cd8f
(cherry picked from commit 02dc98814b515ad4ac19f71b5fdbe0dc5f045098)

commit_message:
Updates for testing period for 20.01 release

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

Change-Id: I65d378de1b124c3c668e05bb37c79fe45596747b

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: Ie526c3fed0d6a1c706d5ef17e9c1bcb38418e861

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I9b345814296b5c6269d2634fc42b947f95cad389

be exactly the same, otherwise issues might raise.

We also introduce glance_image_cache_stall_time variable to control

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/glance/train/admin/cache.html#configuration-options-for-the-image-cache

Change-Id: Ic229e71978961546cec5f58a9c963c71e05ffba4

commit_message:
Add glance cache variables into glance-api

In glance caching doc is stated[1], that some of the variables
should be defined in both glance-api and glance-cache config and should
be exactly the same, otherwise issues might raise.

We also introduce glance_image_cache_stall_time variable to control
cache time reliable across config files

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/glance/train/admin/cache.html#configuration-options-for-the-image-cache

Change-Id: Ic229e71978961546cec5f58a9c963c71e05ffba4

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Stein)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ibf9b20b993ab59b64bd4c954cfcd34f14e0e078c

commit_message:
Add option to create systemd native service overrides

Since there might be a necessity to override already existing in the
system services, like provided ones by system packages, which we
just want to adjust, we need option to create service overrides in
systemd.servce.d directory.

Change-Id: Ic7488edbc0487fe932c706dc26f2f8adb36cb427

commit_message:
Add possibility to configure systemd sockets

We need to be able to configure systemd-sockets. Since they are attached
to the service it make sense to make it as an element to the service.

Change-Id: Ic481921151fc8d7af7f1ca9b003adb8e3c967e16

messages:
[{'account_id': 32643, 'date': '2021-01-08 17:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32643, 'date': '2021-01-08 20:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Set Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 32643, 'date': '2021-01-12 22:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32643, 'date': '2021-01-12 22:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-13 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Please see inline comment.

Plus, it doesn't check that the key that is fetched against is "res_test-IPaddr2" which is implicitly done in the existing tests due to using the underlying database instance.  It would be good to verify this using an assert_called_once_with on the get mock.'}, {'account_id': 32643, 'date': '2021-01-13 20:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-14 10:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Remove unused unitdata import

Change-Id: I3320735314f0b03aecec6635ef82ddd44eecaff1
'}, {'created': '2021-01-12 22:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Mock db interactions for pcmk unit tests.

Uses a class decorator to mock the Storage object. Avoids race conditions of the tests.

closes-bug: #1908282

Change-Id: I3320735314f0b03aecec6635ef82ddd44eecaff1
'}, {'created': '2021-01-13 20:21:13.000000000', 'message': 'Mock the sqlite3 kvstore

This patch replaces the sqlite3 kvstore implementation provided by charmhelpers. Patches the kvstore used in pcmk for both the test_pcmk and the test_hacluster_hooks tests.

closes-bug: #1908282

Change-Id: I3320735314f0b03aecec6635ef82ddd44eecaff1
'}]
commit_message:
Mock the sqlite3 kvstore

This patch replaces the sqlite3 kvstore implementation provided by charmhelpers. Patches the kvstore used in pcmk for both the test_pcmk and the test_hacluster_hooks tests.

closes-bug: #1908282

Change-Id: I3320735314f0b03aecec6635ef82ddd44eecaff1

subject: Bump version for the start of Puppet OpenStack Wallaby
messages:
[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-12-29 02:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-12-30 13:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The last release for many of these was 17.x. Is there a reason for skipping over a minor version and going right to 18.1.0 (instead of 18.0.0)?'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-12-31 09:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> The last release for many of these was 17.x. Is there a reason for skipping over a minor version and going right to 18.1.0 (instead of 18.0.0)?

Yes, skip it, the last Victoria version is the same'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-04 10:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, for Victoria, 17.1.0 was used at milestone 1 (17.0.0 was skipped) but for Ussuri, 16.0.0 was used at milestone 1. I'm not sure we should continue skipping versions as it can be confusing to users.

Was there a good reason for skipping 17.0.0 in victoria, and skipping 18.0.0 in wallaby ?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-04 10:16:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Yes, for Victoria, 17.1.0 was used at milestone 1 (17.0.0 was skipped) but for Ussuri, 16.0.0 was used at milestone 1. I'm not sure we should continue skipping versions as it can be confusing to users.

+1

> 
> Was there a good reason for skipping 17.0.0 in victoria, and skipping 18.0.0 in wallaby ?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-08 09:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hello,

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Yes, for Victoria, 17.1.0 was used at milestone 1 (17.0.0 was skipped) but for Ussuri, 16.0.0 was used at milestone 1. I'm not sure we should continue skipping versions as it can be confusing to users.
> 
> Was there a good reason for skipping 17.0.0 in victoria, and skipping 18.0.0 in wallaby ?

@zhongshengping: Any update? ^"}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-01-12 11:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-12 13:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Major versions LGTM'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-14 10:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-12 07:00:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Anyway these changes LGTM, feel free to choose the right scenario that fit your needs:
- continue to release a victoria version
- abandon these projects
- move to the independent release model

I only +1 for now to let you choose, lemme know when you will have decided, I'll adapt my vote accordingly."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-01-12 10:06:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

thanks Herve I'll refactor to move them to independent later  as discussed on the list i think it's a good idea"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-01-12 12:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> thanks Herve I'll refactor to move them to independent later  as discussed on the list i think it's a good idea

sorry to mess around Herve. I changed my mind. IMO we should merge this adding my +1 here also and I don't see any objections thus far.

As I wrote in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019778.html just now I also reached out to Heat. If they want them great. Otherwise I will post a new patch next week or so and move these to independent."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-12 12:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > thanks Herve I'll refactor to move them to independent later  as discussed on the list i think it's a good idea
> 
> sorry to mess around Herve. I changed my mind. IMO we should merge this adding my +1 here also and I don't see any objections thus far.

No problem, we are here to help you.

> 
> As I wrote in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019778.html just now I also reached out to Heat. If they want them great. Otherwise I will post a new patch next week or so and move these to independent.

If you think that the way to follow then let's go!
I think that this path gives us more flexibility, so LGTM"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-14 09:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-14 06:09:46.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 6115d7a7025c17dc8926362127dbf82cbd6f7799.

Reason of revert:Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I2382c8c3fbd2c7e8ea8409364700ac200dd4b2d2
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 6115d7a7025c17dc8926362127dbf82cbd6f7799.

Reason of revert:Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I2382c8c3fbd2c7e8ea8409364700ac200dd4b2d2

commit_message:
[WIP] Experiment with openstack-httpd base image

If done well, this should bring several advantages, such as reducing
the total size of the images, speed up the build, and simplify the
templates.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-27 22:06:42.000000000', 'message': "Add deleton_policy to network port resources

In perparation for trainsition from composable network
ports  managed by heat, to composable network ports
managed with other tooling.

The upgrade prepare step need to set ``PortDeletionPolicy``
to 'retain', so that network ports are not deleted when
running converge.

Change-Id: I16281faefdf68fcaee4c51caa47516ea7084418b
Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
"}]
commit_message:
Add deleton_policy to network port resources

In perparation for trainsition from composable network
ports  managed by heat, to composable network ports
managed with other tooling.

The upgrade prepare step need to set ``PortDeletionPolicy``
to 'retain', so that network ports are not deleted when
running converge.

Change-Id: I16281faefdf68fcaee4c51caa47516ea7084418b
Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports

commit_message:
Run npm nodejs job with Firefox browser

This patch update browser from PhantomJS to Firefox
in karma.conf.js becuase nodejs-run-test job fails
with PhantomJS browser. So let's switch to Firefox
browser now later once we fix issue with PhantomJS
then we can use it.

Change-Id: I2c82374eae4c4a05848af47cdae3ed4776a60f94

in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

commit_message:
Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 6acaab010eccb4d4cff3a5127b942065ed7cdae8.

Reason of revert:Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: Ide1c309d491b8aa008a064dba554f18aa5c489d6

[{'created': '2020-12-18 15:39:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7605656435ef9011474d2263bf8b175f0b6b2de7
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7605656435ef9011474d2263bf8b175f0b6b2de7

Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782
(cherry picked from commit ab6c59b57e732def62e3817a80d081b8392d669a)

commit_message:
Fix calling of add_tunnel_port method from sanity checks module

Sanity checks functions which are checking if vxlan and geneve tunnels
are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters
to the ovs_lib.OVSBridge.add_tunnel_port method.
Previously port_name was missing.

Closes-Bug: #1905568
Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782
(cherry picked from commit ab6c59b57e732def62e3817a80d081b8392d669a)

commit_message:
Fix gate failure

Bumped a bunch of constraints and requirements to fix
a gate failure with recent pip update. Fix associated
new warnings.

Had to change job definition to disable IPv6 metadata
test a different way.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/767287

Change-Id: Icd09952f267ba734b6719b96636108bd27ececea

commit_message:
Add deleton_policy to network resources

In preparation for trainsition from composable networks
managed by heat, to composable networks managed with other
tooling.

The upgrade prepare step need to set this to 'retain', so
that networks are not deleted when running converge.

Change-Id: Ib65d74a2005fbc13cbc7916e646da65d99410adb

commit_message:
[Part1] Remove six

six.text_type
six.py3

The Python 2.7 Support has been dropped since Ussuri.
So remove hacking rules for compatibility between python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I86565a96f3c5a254e0ee8af3d265df3bb2422b32

[{'created': '2021-01-14 06:19:58.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 764e43083040dd4025e2864f11db77a57aea4b9c.

Reason of revert :Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I1984fe34be137de7c1e6a96f2fd8e8f1d9e35a31
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 764e43083040dd4025e2864f11db77a57aea4b9c.

Reason of revert :Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I1984fe34be137de7c1e6a96f2fd8e8f1d9e35a31

> Sounds like there a problem related to the molecule test on train:
> 
> 2021-01-11 07:28:44.087753 | TASK [ensure-docker : Install upstream docker using package]
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.355416 | centos-8 | ERROR
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.356287 | centos-8 | {
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.356444 | centos-8 |   "failures": [],
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.356608 | centos-8 |   "msg": "Depsolve Error occured: \n Problem: problem with installed package podman-1.6.4-23.module_el8.3.0+566+4759265c.x86_64\n  - package podman-1.6.4-23.module_el8.3.0+566+4759265c.x86_64 requires runc >= 1.0.0-57, but none of the providers can be installed\n  - package containerd.io-1.4.3-3.1.el8.x86_64 conflicts with runc provided by runc-1.0.0-64.rc10.module_el8.3.0+479+69e2ae26.x86_64\n  - package containerd.io-1.4.3-3.1.el8.x86_64 obsoletes runc provided by runc-1.0.0-64.rc10.module_el8.3.0+479+69e2ae26.x86_64\n  - cannot install the best candidate for the job\n  - package runc-1.0.0-68.rc92.module_el8.3.0+475+c50ce30b.x86_64 is filtered out by modular filtering",
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.356805 | centos-8 |   "rc": 1,
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.356950 | centos-8 |   "results": []
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.357096 | centos-8 | }
> 2021-01-11 07:28:46.387802 |

@Alex I see this is related to the issue [1] which is supposed to solved by [2]. In zuul (pre.yaml) I see the same change [3] and I'm wondering what we can do (as a workaround until the jobs are moved to podman) to make it work.
Can you help on this?


[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1909445
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/31439/4/playbooks/tripleo-rdo-base/container-login.yaml
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/stable/train/zuul.d/playbooks/pre.yml#L25-L35'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-01-13 22:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-01-13 22:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Run LVM filter tasks when enabled, regardless of allow/deny list size

When the LVM filter is enabled, it should also run when the allow list
is empty.

Change-Id: I88ec250cb3e29c08ce7e7f5e02b5e7e48f997fea
Closes-Bug: #1907452
(cherry picked from commit 20f1e9766befc0d5c86e6deae45c5ca3de101b38)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I2c450c25cb8f97575df3f4f518ca179c4cf2dffd

commit_message:
Add NovaImageTypeExcludeList parameter

Add support for the [compute]/image_type_exclude_list parameter to
prevent image types being reported as supported by a compute node.

Depends-On: I389d4b586468720d73ac69b025a3c34df54fe73e
Change-Id: I326cb9facf33693fdf8f361f9bc58aa28b3c20af

[{'created': '2020-12-16 10:03:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use default-worker instead of production_group

At present, resize cluster invocation via the magnum-ui fails because it
tries to resize production_group nodegroup which is not a thing. Until
we support ability to specify nodegroups, we ought to use the default of
default-worker nodegroup.

Change-Id: I3e9553e6d337ab1580c0e3bb3d1a88e8b97f2f23
(cherry picked from commit fb8eee430e5593166973ab09917a04df0be7cf91)

At present, resize cluster invocation via the magnum-ui fails because it
tries to resize production_group nodegroup which is not a thing. Until
we support ability to specify nodegroups, we ought to use the default of
default-worker nodegroup.

Change-Id: I3e9553e6d337ab1580c0e3bb3d1a88e8b97f2f23

commit_message:
Use default-worker instead of production_group

At present, resize cluster invocation via the magnum-ui fails because it
tries to resize production_group nodegroup which is not a thing. Until
we support ability to specify nodegroups, we ought to use the default of
default-worker nodegroup.

Change-Id: I3e9553e6d337ab1580c0e3bb3d1a88e8b97f2f23
(cherry picked from commit fb8eee430e5593166973ab09917a04df0be7cf91)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 06:29:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix operational status for disabled UDP listeners

Disabled UDP listeners appeared as ONLINE, as the heartbeat message
always showed listeners as OPEN, even if disabled.

This commit fixes the configuration file for UDP listeners, previously
enabling or disabling a UDP listener created the same config file. Now
disabling a UDP listener explicitly adds a comment in the file.

Based on this comment, the heartbeat message doesn't include status
updates for disabled UDP listeners.

Conflicts:
  octavia/tests/unit/common/jinja/lvs/test_lvs_jinja_cfg.py

commit_message:
Fix operational status for disabled UDP listeners

Disabled UDP listeners appeared as ONLINE, as the heartbeat message
always showed listeners as OPEN, even if disabled.

This commit fixes the configuration file for UDP listeners, previously
enabling or disabling a UDP listener created the same config file. Now
disabling a UDP listener explicitly adds a comment in the file.

Based on this comment, the heartbeat message doesn't include status
updates for disabled UDP listeners.

Conflicts:
  octavia/tests/unit/common/jinja/lvs/test_lvs_jinja_cfg.py

Story: 2007979
Task: 40605

Change-Id: I400dde533f78bc14ee568bfd9714eafac97e8a39
(cherry picked from commit bb4f50f798dd5619185cebc5f3db9a55e7f6122e)
(cherry picked from commit 8fe7cff8dc3f95c229f3e7a1608c414a495e515a)

subject: Use same code path for UpdatePrepare
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-01-06 03:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-01-11 22:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-01-12 10:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I would like Sofer or Mathieu to have a look at the change if possible, adding them as reviewers.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-01-12 15:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hey, thanks for looking into this.

So that looks good, I have some questions.

Comparing the output with another jobs I see this whole block "PLAY [Deploy Deployment Plan]"[1] replacing [2]. I got the feeling that in the end they do the same thing (generating the the template?)

My question is then "is that expected and harmless or should we look more into it" ?

Another question, I see that in that block we "Run Validations", do we want to run validation at that point in the update ?

I'm setting -1, just to make sure that we looked into this. If some more investigation is needed, let me know.

Overall great stuff here, less code is better code :)

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/5bb6ebe1428d4c47bbf54025156f241e/log/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_update_prepare.log#76-113
[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/c0e9388a3ca84f39a07ed32d7758f3ab/log/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_update_prepare.log#70-226'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-01-12 15:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> My question is then "is that expected and harmless or should we look more into it" ?

'Deploy Deployment Plan' does nothing other than updating the stack using the plan. So it's not different from stack update using heat api done earlier.

> Another question, I see that in that block we "Run Validations", do we want to run validation at that point in the update ?

That task is skipped.

2021-01-06 06:20:58 | 2021-01-06 06:20:58.819059 | bc764e04-4d91-a0a9-0d58-00000000000b |       TASK | Run Validations

2021-01-06 06:20:58 | 2021-01-06 06:20:58.858624 | bc764e04-4d91-a0a9-0d58-00000000000b |    SKIPPED | Run Validations | localhost

This is part of a series to remove the swift plan, you won't see these playbooks/tasks in a subsequent patch[1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/765808'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-01-13 10:19:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Ok, thanks for the replies, let's merge this and move on."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 03:40:12.000000000', 'message': "Use same code path for UpdatePrepare

We don't do anything different here other than updating the
stack.

Change-Id: I1050b3e0760153266ecf03d87140365ee9c8d072
"}]
commit_message:
Use same code path for UpdatePrepare

We don't do anything different here other than updating the
stack.

Change-Id: I1050b3e0760153266ecf03d87140365ee9c8d072

commit_message:
[WIP] Support for Action Driver

Supported:
* Created new ActionDriver framework
* Add standard action for Instantiation, Termination
  Scaling and Healing
* Call ActionDriver executor from vnflcm_driver
* Read implementation from VNFD

Change-Id: I0cbee5766f324e7c35266175f17bb27750adc84e

commit_message:
Drop python_cmd set_Fact

We no longer require this since we moved the container-puppet.py into
ansible.

Change-Id: I673e79d7e1963c4bbdb29ff966ff8fff48878743

(1 comment)

We should call the "setup" module in the role directly and just get the right subset of data, such as:
    - name: Gather only subset of facts                                                                                
      setup:                          
        gather_subset:           
          - '!all'                                         
          - '!any'                   
          - '!min'                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
          - env
It will be faster. Really.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-12-15 15:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-12-15 15:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Better, but we probably want to:
- avoid useless task such as set_fact
- ensure we don't do weird things in Molecule either (i.e. keep the "gather_facts: false" and, if needed in the prepare.yml, filter only the needed bits)

While the first point is a "nice to have" for a follow-up, the second part might mask issues in the roles, especially in the "converge.yml"...
Sorry ^^'.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-12-15 16:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

[{'created': '2020-12-09 15:07:31.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Get the undercloud.conf file from where it actually is

Since the deprecation of Mistral in THT, we can't get the path of this
file by using hiera anymore. This patch will get it directly in its
original place ($HOME/undercloud.conf)

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iafc38c6cd99edee89ae0305f09fe7080df148331

"}, {'created': '2020-12-10 11:01:54.000000000', 'message': "Get the undercloud.conf file from where it actually is

Since the deprecation of Mistral in THT, we can't get the path of this
file by using hiera anymore. This patch will get it directly in its
original place ($HOME/undercloud.conf) by using *ansible_env.HOME* fact.

This patch also fixes every molecule tests accordingly.

NB: check_network_gateway molecule test is now voting in the CI.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iafc38c6cd99edee89ae0305f09fe7080df148331

commit_message:
Get the undercloud.conf file from where it actually is

Since the deprecation of Mistral in THT, we can't get the path of this
file by using hiera anymore. This patch will get it directly in its
original place ($HOME/undercloud.conf) by using *ansible_env.HOME* fact.

Impacted Validations:
 playbooks/ceilometerdb-size.yaml
 playbooks/check-network-gateway.yaml
 playbooks/check-undercloud-conf.yaml
 playbooks/container-status.yaml
 playbooks/ctlplane-ip-range.yaml
 playbooks/dhcp-provisioning.yaml
 playbooks/neutron-sanity-check.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-pre-deployment.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-prep.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-heat-purge-deleted.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-process-count.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-tokenflush.yaml

This patch also fixes every molecule tests accordingly.

NB: check_network_gateway molecule test is now voting in the CI.

Closes-Bug: 1907553

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iafc38c6cd99edee89ae0305f09fe7080df148331

    v3-ms-dos-client:   support

commit_message:
[NetApp] Support NFS shares on windows

Set following 4 attributes when creating nfs shares:
    showmount:          enabled
    v3-ms-dos-client:   support
    v3-connection-drop: disable
    ejukebox-errors:    disable

Change-Id: I86c3de32d36940e85545fcb337723e4b3edce216
Closes-bug: 1901937
Co-authored-by: Maurice Escher <maurice.escher@sap.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5e01d9e292582bbd1e6a87cec8b92874996585f7)
(cherry picked from commit 1af6f4925111a58c15f8ce2789933243f31ffc9f)
(cherry picked from commit e08683fab336e431a11239ffc40af2d05602e8c3)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary joinedload

This patch removes an unnecessary joinedload when looking up a
load balancer from an amphora ID. This should reduce the database
load when this method is called.

Change-Id: I04bb38c657c87ace941eb6e332f58f7218980ad1
(cherry picked from commit b627d7cf725b095f18e10728e9adc21abba1cdc9)

commit_message:
Volume type: Update is_public attribute

This change introduces --public and --private option to volume type
set command, so that users can update is_public attribute of volume
types.

Story: 2008478
Task: 41518
Change-Id: I3731255648dc91c023a1390c3b37e68b6608f850

[{'created': '2020-11-10 15:39:48.000000000', 'message': 'BM workflow - pre-deployed server

Change-Id: I19c1028664ee30ee1162c02e6efc723ca8816b14
'}, {'created': '2020-11-30 11:19:13.000000000', 'message': "BM workflow - pre_provisioned server support

Adds boolean option 'pre_provisioned' to the
YAML defining baremetal deployments. When an
instance is defined with 'pre_provisioned: True'
it indicates that the server is already deployed.

A 'pre_provisioned' instnace must have a 'fixed_ip'
defining the IP address of the already provisioned
server.

Adds module: tripleo_pre_provisioned_populate_environment
which merges the pre-provisioned instance to the
baremetal environment.

Adding the support for 'pre_provsioned' in the YAML
used to define a baremetal deployment provides a
unified UX for pre-provisioned and ironic/metalsmith
provisioned instances. It also keeps the interface to
manage neutron ports for composable networks identical
for for pre-provisioned and ironic/metalsmith.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I19c1028664ee30ee1162c02e6efc723ca8816b14

commit_message:
Provision workflow managed/unmanaged node support

Adds boolean option 'managed' to the YAML defining
baremetal deployments. When an instance is defined with
'managed: false' it indicates that the server is already
deployed.

Also adds option 'management_ip' to the YAML defining
baremetal deployments. Any instnace with 'managed: false'
must either have a 'fixed_ip' defining the IP address
of the already provisioned server. Or it must have a
'management_ip' set.

Adds module: tripleo_unmanaged_populate_environment
which merges the 'managed: false' instance to the
baremetal environment.

Adding the support for 'managed' in the YAML used to
define a baremetal deployment provides a unified UX for
pre-provisioned and ironic/metalsmith provisioned
instances. It also keeps the interface to manage neutron
ports for composable networks identical for for
pre-provisioned and ironic/metalsmith instances.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I19c1028664ee30ee1162c02e6efc723ca8816b14

subject: [stable/train] Update requirements and constraints
messages: [{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-14 00:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-14 00:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nWrongly submitted - real patch is here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/770207'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-14 00:51:48.000000000', 'message': '[stable/train] Update requirements and constraints

pip 20.3 brings in a strict dependency resolver which
is enabled by default. This dependency resolver
unearthed the error in our tox file where we
were constraining our lower-constraints job with both
upper and lower constraints files.

The upper constraint file was being pulled in because
we had an unnecessary "pip install" command added as
"install_command". We have removed the use of
install_command from ussuri [1]; but the older branches
need to be addressed.

As a result of fixing our tests, we're also
having to update the lower bounds of some
requirements on this branch.

Version changes for direct dependencies:
* eventlet (0.18.2 --> 0.24.1)
(0.25.2 is the upper-constraint)
* oslo.messaging (5.29.0 --> 6.4.1)
(6.4.1 was released 2018 June, during Rocky [4]
upper-constraint is 9.5.2)
* oslo.service (1.24.0 --> 1.31.0)
(1.31.0 was released 2018 April, during Rocky [5]
upper-constraint is 1.38.1)
* psycopg2-binary (2.6.2-->2.8.3)
(psycopg2-binary is a unit test requirement)

Version changes for transitive dependencies:
* MarkupSafe (1.0 --> 1.1.1)
(1.1.1 is the upper-constraint)
* psutil (5.4.3 --> 5.6.3)
(5.6.3 is the upper-constraint)

[1] I6344f44fb955d631a4f0a13fa53ecc19826c7ea6
[2] http://pyfound.blogspot.com/2020/11/pip-20-3-new-resolver.html

commit_message:
[stable/train] Update requirements and constraints

pip 20.3 brings in a strict dependency resolver which
is enabled by default. This dependency resolver
unearthed the error in our tox file where we
were constraining our lower-constraints job with both
upper and lower constraints files.

The upper constraint file was being pulled in because
we had an unnecessary "pip install" command added as
"install_command". We have removed the use of
install_command from ussuri [1]; but the older branches
need to be addressed.

As a result of fixing our tests, we're also
having to update the lower bounds of some
requirements on this branch.

Version changes for direct dependencies:
* eventlet (0.18.2 --> 0.24.1)
(0.25.2 is the upper-constraint)
* oslo.messaging (5.29.0 --> 6.4.1)
(6.4.1 was released 2018 June, during Rocky [4]
upper-constraint is 9.5.2)
* oslo.service (1.24.0 --> 1.31.0)
(1.31.0 was released 2018 April, during Rocky [5]
upper-constraint is 1.38.1)
* psycopg2-binary (2.6.2-->2.8.3)
(psycopg2-binary is a unit test requirement)

Version changes for transitive dependencies:
* MarkupSafe (1.0 --> 1.1.1)
(1.1.1 is the upper-constraint)
* psutil (5.4.3 --> 5.6.3)
(5.6.3 is the upper-constraint)

[1] I6344f44fb955d631a4f0a13fa53ecc19826c7ea6
[2] http://pyfound.blogspot.com/2020/11/pip-20-3-new-resolver.html
[3] https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#changes-to-the-pip-dependency-resolver-in-20-3-2020
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-announce/2018-June/005341.html
[5] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-announce/2018-April/004759.html

Partial-Bug: #1911071
Change-Id: I5e6b855e8c8d7ffed15b6e419169067e1f04a9cb
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix full text search at containers page

Containers page uses the standard Magic Search filtering, however its
full text search option doesn't work.
This patch makes the filtering work properly with full text search.

Closes-Bug: #1902610

Change-Id: Ie784d187c89eba1a2673ecafd72e903115a264d3

seemingly it is used in lower-constraints job, thus the job fails with
contradicting constraints over package 'coverage'. As a minimal fix
the install_command is added to the lower-constraints tox target, too.

sphinx requirements needed to be changed in doc/requirements.txt to
make requirements-check job pass.

pyroute2 version bumped to match os-vif's constraint.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Closes-Bug: #1907438

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and make lower-constraints job non-voting

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

sphinx requirements needed to be changed in doc/requirements.txt to
make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Closes-Bug: #1907438
Change-Id: Ie5221bf37c6ed9268a4aa0737ffcdd811e39360a

commit_message:
[glusterfs] don't reinit volume list on deletion

We don't need to re-initialize the volumes list
on deletion, it still makes sense to add a missing
volume to the list, going by the reasoning defined
in I14835f6c54376737b41cbf78c94908ea1befde15

Related-Bug: #1894362
Change-Id: I96d49f84122a34701328909c929ede4d66746911
(cherry picked from commit 914d87377479ab3951641d658fc461ad2f338ba0)
(cherry picked from commit 2ad9bcc1b42819f7a8c7aa7200e6f8d128294205)

Valeriy asked several important compatability questions in PS2 that
remain unaddressed, the most fundamental of which concern OSC
microversion handling.  I don't see how to go ahead with work on
OSC for manila until we have a better understanding of how OSC
can maintain compatability with the way python-manilaclient handles
microversions."}, {'account_id': 11047, 'date': '2016-11-18 19:38:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I guess microversions is the blocker. What does cinder do? I'm also suggesting here that we use "share" instead of "filesystem" and "filesystem share".  I think that's consistent w/ cinder using "volume" instead of "block volume" and nova using "server" instead of "compute server".  I haven't looked into it much though. It'd be nice to make progress on this.'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2016-11-18 20:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Please see my comments.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2016-11-21 17:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Thanks for working on this!  I'd love to see OSC support for manila.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but there has been no update on the blocking microversion support issue, or on the requirement that we have plugin infra that would allow a manila-only command shell as well for standalone manila services.  If not, then I think this one should remain in the hopper for Queens rather than being a work goal for the Pike cycle."}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2017-04-06 20:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I'd like to see OpenStack Client support for manila as well, but I agree with Tom that the concerns about microversion support are not addressed yet."}, {'account_id': 11047, 'date': '2017-04-09 04:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

still some comments need replies.'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2017-04-13 15:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

It was decided in the weekly meeting that this spec would be pushed our of Pike to Queens'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-13 22:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/manila-specs/specs/release_independent/manila-support-openstackclient.html'}]

commit_message:
Spec for openstack client support

This spec defines the list of manila commands to be implemented in
the python-manilaclient repository as python-openstackclient plugins.

Change-Id: Ib28603a85c78395fd77e4f83ecc62a4998d16788

commit_message:
Remove debug_ms

Having debug_ms enabled populates logs with too much
information. This makes it harder to debug in most cases.
Disable by default.

Change-Id: If180f9be42e95492ab457420e48a494fd2689e6e

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 

Well, the benefit of us pinning it is that we were using a newer pycodestyle than the one specified by hacking.  Master was using 2.6.0 for a while because of:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/734395

This patch
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/744494
seems to have unknowingly reverted the above change, so master is now back to using 2.4.0 via hacking's requirements instead."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-01-11 16:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> 
> Well, the benefit of us pinning it is that we were using a newer pycodestyle than the one specified by hacking.  Master was using 2.6.0 for a while because of:
>     https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/734395
> 
> This patch
>     https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/744494
> seems to have unknowingly reverted the above change, so master is now back to using 2.4.0 via hacking's requirements instead.

We may need to pull in someone who maintains hacking.  My concern with setting pycodestyle to "our" version is that flake8 is restricting pycodescale to only patch releases of a pycodescale point release, and I think hacking is similarly restricting flake8 so that we don't get a openstack-wide breakage from a new flake8 release.  So if we set a pycodescale version ourselves instead of letting hacking handle it by its restrictions on flake8, we may wind up setting an impossible constraint.  But maybe I'm misunderstanding the way this is supposed to work.'}, {'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2021-01-13 08:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2021-01-13 14:09:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

At any rate, I don't see a reason to hold this one up for now."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2021-01-13 19:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-12-18 15:28:06.000000000', 'message': "Adjust requirements and lower-constraints

Conservative changes to get the l-c job passing with the new
pip resolver.

Big changes:
- os-win 3.0.0 -> 4.1.0 (u-c allows 5.2.0)
- oslo.service 1.24.0 -> 1.31.0 (u-c allows 2.4.0)
  * These were the minimum versions that can take eventlet >=0.25.1
    (which os-brick wants)
- pytz 2013.6 -> 2015.7 (u-c allows 2020.1)
  * needed for babel
- remove pycodestyle from test-requirements (let hacking request
  flake8 which will request the pycodestyle version it wants)
- requests 2.14.2 -> 2.19.0 (u-c allows 2.23.0)
  * oslo-config wants >=2.18, but 2.19.0 doesn't use idna (which
    was causing a conflict)

Change-Id: Ic046e1c1cc712eaca3c895b72152eb5b5344c18f
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust requirements and lower-constraints

Conservative changes to get the l-c job passing with the new
pip resolver.

Big changes:
- os-win 3.0.0 -> 4.1.0 (u-c allows 5.2.0)
- oslo.service 1.24.0 -> 1.31.0 (u-c allows 2.4.0)
  * These were the minimum versions that can take eventlet >=0.25.1
    (which os-brick wants)
- pytz 2013.6 -> 2015.7 (u-c allows 2020.1)
  * needed for babel
- remove pycodestyle from test-requirements (let hacking request
  flake8 which will request the pycodestyle version it wants)
- requests 2.14.2 -> 2.19.0 (u-c allows 2.23.0)
  * oslo-config wants >=2.18, but 2.19.0 doesn't use idna (which
    was causing a conflict)

Change-Id: Ic046e1c1cc712eaca3c895b72152eb5b5344c18f
