revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-13 10:09:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add a storm-base image

Refactor storm image dependencies. Previously we had:

base -> storm -> monasca-thresh

Both storm and monasca-thresh images are final, and each includes a
footer. This causes issues when the footer expects to be at the end of
the image, or there to be only a single footer. In particular, since
I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe, the footer used in CI jobs
reverts to the public package mirrors.

This change introduces a storm-base image, and refactors the dependency
chain:

base -> storm-base -> storm
base -> storm-base -> monasca-thresh

Related-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I53e8ba8d4baa4434cf3c49ed94d1f7cb44099bee
(cherry picked from commit 93204ecfeca7ba394bd4c3872147357aa708f46e)

commit_message:
Add a storm-base image

Refactor storm image dependencies. Previously we had:

base -> storm -> monasca-thresh

Both storm and monasca-thresh images are final, and each includes a
footer. This causes issues when the footer expects to be at the end of
the image, or there to be only a single footer. In particular, since
I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe, the footer used in CI jobs
reverts to the public package mirrors.

This change introduces a storm-base image, and refactors the dependency
chain:

base -> storm-base -> storm
base -> storm-base -> monasca-thresh

Related-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I53e8ba8d4baa4434cf3c49ed94d1f7cb44099bee
(cherry picked from commit 93204ecfeca7ba394bd4c3872147357aa708f46e)

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints & requirements

Bump some lower-constraints because of the new pip release.

Cap bandit because new releases don't support python 2.7.
Fix bandit command line in tox config to exclude files from the tests/
directory.

Change-Id: If830a35fbcb679943e94adb821755eadf828c248

commit_message:
Add setuptools.

Add setuptools in requirements file.

Like explain here[1] the setuptools is used but not explicitly install
by the project. It's install by pbr at the moment, but explicit is
better than implicit.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/017740.html

Change-Id: I3b6930ff2ed0d845f3ab990e26f449a47eeee8d2

commit_message:
Simplify composition of swift-proxy-server pipelines

This change refactors the logic to genrate swift-proxy-server pipelines
by replacing current usage of yaql by native list_concat function.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I94072958f87609bf02ea56e60a5064a18427f816

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: I2b9393b388840c8903ca267b8d5e66536be8d267

commit_message:
Mock the sqlite3 kvstore

This patch replaces the sqlite3 kvstore implementation provided by charmhelpers. Patches the kvstore used in pcmk for both the test_pcmk and the test_hacluster_hooks tests.

closes-bug: #1908282

Change-Id: I291f9e67629851610b9b650de7be4726e56a8d91

[{'created': '2020-12-25 03:52:05.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ia0fa4ba1fecf2740a291c5a65b906b089c95404d

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ia0fa4ba1fecf2740a291c5a65b906b089c95404d

[{'created': '2020-12-03 08:36:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix calling of add_tunnel_port method from sanity checks module

Sanity checks functions which are checking if vxlan and geneve tunnels
are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters
to the ovs_lib.OVSBridge.add_tunnel_port method.
Previously port_name was missing.

Closes-Bug: #1905568
Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782
(cherry picked from commit ab6c59b57e732def62e3817a80d081b8392d669a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix calling of add_tunnel_port method from sanity checks module

Sanity checks functions which are checking if vxlan and geneve tunnels
are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters
to the ovs_lib.OVSBridge.add_tunnel_port method.
Previously port_name was missing.

Closes-Bug: #1905568
Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782
(cherry picked from commit ab6c59b57e732def62e3817a80d081b8392d669a)

commit_message:
Fix support for policy.yaml

This change fixes support for policy.yaml, which was broken because
of the following problems.
 - The default content was still formatted in json
 - Augeas doesn't support flat yaml contents required

Change-Id: Ie308a481eb70d5f930633b18d8044f9542a142af

commit_message:
Add new VNIC types for Cyborg provisioned ports

Added VNIC types ``accelerator-direct`` and
``accelerator-direct-physical``. Represents a port that supports any
kind of hardware acceleration and is provided by Cyborg

Change-Id: I32e16a7cf3809e2469b3e7a7e068c8f0849ccdfb
Related-Bug: #1909100

Drop settings for python2

As Ussuri+ we no longer support py2(centos7), Dropping settings for
python2 environments.

commit_message:
Uncap jsonschema

jsonschema was uncapped in the global requirements. We need to uncap it
locally now too.

NOTE(stephenfin): This is needed to resolve conflicts with the new
dependency resolver found in pip 20.3. We also need to include the
following additional requirement-related changes to get things passing:

- doc/requirements.txt
  Ensure specific versions of Sphinx are used on different Python
  versions.

- lower-constraints.txt
  Remove hacking since it's not necessary

- test-requirements.txt
  Remove hacking since it's not necessary

- tox.ini
  Set a hacking version to avoid installing the latest and greatest
  versions

Change-Id: Ia6ad2c7e62aebc81386610e9d16c8bb8a162d70f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c7bb5d65abb4c9bc3a1d8f480018a9d661f7b36e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-09 13:54:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add upgrade check about old computes

Report a warning during upgrade checks if there are computes older than
the previous major nova release in the system.

So if code is upgraded to N+1 and the upgrade check was run before
the restart of the services with N+1 code then the check warns for N-1
computes in the system.

There are small modification in the documentation and code comment to
align it to the Victoria context.

Change-Id: I873b0c1e6e695ae88241bbf75ac9f80ecc6f5664
(cherry picked from commit 3b8257cd239d0bb52cb654d709cc579ca9841628)

commit_message:
Add upgrade check about old computes

Report a warning during upgrade checks if there are computes older than
the previous major nova release in the system.

So if code is upgraded to N+1 and the upgrade check was run before
the restart of the services with N+1 code then the check warns for N-1
computes in the system.

There are small modification in the documentation and code comment to
align it to the Victoria context.

Related-Bug: #1903545

Change-Id: I873b0c1e6e695ae88241bbf75ac9f80ecc6f5664
(cherry picked from commit 3b8257cd239d0bb52cb654d709cc579ca9841628)

[{'created': '2020-12-09 08:20:13.000000000', 'message': 'Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero

When a compute node has zero total available for the:

  * MEMORY_MB
  * DISK_GB
  * VGPU
  * PMEM_NAMESPACE_*

resource classes, we attempt to PUT an inventory with 'total' of 0
which isn't allowed by the placement API. Doing this results in a 400
error from placement "JSON does not validate: 0 is less than the
minimum of 1" and ResourceProviderUpdateFailed and
ResourceProviderSyncFailed raised in nova.

We are already omitting most resource classes when their total amount
of the resource is 0 and we just need to also do it for the
aforementioned resource classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901120
Closes-Bug: #1906494

Change-Id: I022f3bbddbbdc24362b10004f273da2421788c97
(cherry picked from commit 0b942dcaa5db81f927d1a300cb839b4e6c4d1c5e)
'}]
commit_message:
Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero

When a compute node has zero total available for the:

  * MEMORY_MB
  * DISK_GB
  * VGPU
  * PMEM_NAMESPACE_*

resource classes, we attempt to PUT an inventory with 'total' of 0
which isn't allowed by the placement API. Doing this results in a 400
error from placement "JSON does not validate: 0 is less than the
minimum of 1" and ResourceProviderUpdateFailed and
ResourceProviderSyncFailed raised in nova.

We are already omitting most resource classes when their total amount
of the resource is 0 and we just need to also do it for the
aforementioned resource classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901120
Closes-Bug: #1906494

Change-Id: I022f3bbddbbdc24362b10004f273da2421788c97
(cherry picked from commit 0b942dcaa5db81f927d1a300cb839b4e6c4d1c5e)

commit_message:
Convert docker molecule usage to podman

This change updates all uses of docker to podman and removes our docker
installation process from zuul and our local test process. Some container
based tests have been moved to "delegated" becuase they no longer make
sense to run in a container and the hacks needed to maintain the container
based testing are not worth maintaining for podman.

Change-Id: I02de94a1229bfa847f14ecf282eadbcfe6396875
(cherry picked from commit 74f2f8187054dc10e1bbff50feba2b5abfc7b2a4)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Fix tripleo_podman molecule jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 19:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tripleo_podman molecule jobs

With the latest version of podman, attempting to leverage port binding
on a non-privileged account for the host no longer works. We need to run
the registry as root in order for it to properly bind 5000.  This will
need to be backported all the way to train.

Change-Id: I345e8b8547b81e5791656d0fca6e90b1de48fdac
(cherry picked from commit 34ec5382a37a89323d3440cb90492f13053458fd)

commit_message:
Fix tripleo_podman molecule jobs

In order to launch the container and connect via networking, we need
selinux disabled for a rootless container to still work. Let's move the
selinux disabling to first rather than later.

Change-Id: I345e8b8547b81e5791656d0fca6e90b1de48fdac
(cherry picked from commit 31bed0daa3c5c82a5b0afe1c51824b35f0dceeb5)

commit_message:
Add northbound API support for meters

Add meter (name) attribute to the ACL row, via sg_acl_add().

Add helpers for adding, removing, getting and listing rows of the
Meter table.

Change-Id: I076269d3d666caa5ebe3d70111136c78393c7c5f

commit_message:
Proposition to resolve bug #1782798

This change delete the equivalence between /openstack/log and /var/log.
So the selinux rule nova_log_t can be applied. And we can keep selinux
support for CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I6d10938815b69755f5e138d1feae67f99e988f95

[{'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-10-30 17:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-01 12:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Holding this back until the master patch merges.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-12-02 08:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-12-02 16:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just to mention I'll leave it for others to decide if we even *want* this change in the stable branch, because I'm not sure if we allow service catalog changes during a stable release.

The alternative approach would be to just have a "known issue" reno that explains how rgw is *not* a direct drop-in replacement in the stable/rocky configuration, how deployers can override it so they make it one, and that once stable/stein rolls around things will be right from the get-go.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-12-04 10:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This review no long matches the contents of the merged patch in master. Also, given the service catalog change, we may need to increment the minor revision for openstack_release here and add an upgrade note making it clear that the service catalog entries will update.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-12-04 16:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Right; as mentioned here before I don't even know whether we *want* the service catalog change in the middle of the stable release. Maybe only add a "known issue" reno instead, with instructions on how to modify the configuration if people *want* AUTH_%(tenant_id)s in the endpoint?'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-01-13 18:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 17:59:10.000000000', 'message': 'Include Swift AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix in rgw Keystone endpoint

In order to make rgw a better drop-in replacement for Swift, this
patch does two things:

* Configure rgw to include the Swift account in its URL
* Update the Keystone catalog entry so that the rgw endpoints
  include the AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix (just like the os_swift
  role does)

Both of the above are necessary to make both public read ACLs
and temp URLs work with rgw, the way they do with native Swift.

In addition, the patch also:

* Removes the rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone config override, which
  is useless in the default configuration that does not enable
  the S3 API.
* Adds documentation to the users guide, about using rgw as a
  Swift replacement.
* Adds a release note detailing possible upgrade issues.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/user/index.rst

Fixes-Bug: #1800637
Change-Id: Iacd8f32f100f283ff590e063854d06b2c7c98cc2
'}, {'created': '2018-12-02 08:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Include Swift AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix in rgw Keystone endpoint

In order to make rgw a better drop-in replacement for Swift, this
patch does two things:

* Configure rgw to include the Swift account in its URL
* Update the Keystone catalog entry so that the rgw endpoints
  include the AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix (just like the os_swift
  role does)

Both of the above are necessary to make both public read ACLs
and temp URLs work with rgw, the way they do with native Swift.

In addition, the patch also:

* Removes the rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone config override, which
  is useless in the default configuration that does not enable
  the S3 API.
* Adds documentation to the users guide, about using rgw as a

* Adds a release note detailing possible upgrade issues.

Conflicts:

Fixes-Bug: #1800637
Change-Id: Iacd8f32f100f283ff590e063854d06b2c7c98cc2
'}]
commit_message:
Include Swift AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix in rgw Keystone endpoint

In order to make rgw a better drop-in replacement for Swift, this
patch does two things:

* Configure rgw to include the Swift account in its URL
* Update the Keystone catalog entry so that the rgw endpoints
  include the AUTH_%(tenant_id)s suffix (just like the os_swift
  role does)

Both of the above are necessary to make both public read ACLs
and temp URLs work with rgw, the way they do with native Swift.

In addition, the patch also:

* Removes the rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone config override, which
  is useless in the default configuration that does not enable
  the S3 API.
* Adds documentation to the users guide, about using rgw as a
  Swift replacement.
* Adds a release note detailing possible upgrade issues.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/user/index.rst

Fixes-Bug: #1800637
Change-Id: Iacd8f32f100f283ff590e063854d06b2c7c98cc2

commit_message:
Enable Ceph daemons to bind to IPv6 addresses

If DevStack is deployed with IPv6 enabled, we need to configure
Ceph to also use IPv6 addresses.

This patch sets enable ms_bind_ipv6 and disable ms_bind_ipv4.

Not related to the patch but intended: remove debug_ms. This
debugging option is way too verbose and fills our development
environments and our CI logs with information that might not
be always needed

Change-Id: I47c1b18c29ea80e87addf06ee3ff4915d07303e8
Closes-Bug: #1902099

commit_message:
Add pre-run playbook to clean up CI nodes before OSA tests run

Switch the apt sources from https to http. Remove blacklists on
yum and zypper repos.

commit_message:
Use pip_install_upper_constraints for plugin deps

This commit allows including OSA global constraints when installing
tempest plugins.  In gating, this includes openstack-ansible's
global-requirement-pins.txt via a URL.  In a full deployment, it
includes requirements_absolute_requirements.txt as retrieved from the
repo server, to which openstack-ansible/global-requirement-pins.txt was
accounted for in the repo build process.

Related-Bug: 1890492

Change-Id: I2ca1ca515f4a499f86bcebb943c3a967a772f23e

subject: Remove dragonflow ML2 driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-07 17:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-10 22:19:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck - It looks like at least some of the failures were caused by cert validation issues from https://mirror.iad.rax.opendev.org/.  Let's see if this was transitory."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-08-11 05:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-08-11 05:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> recheck - It looks like at least some of the failures were caused
 > by cert validation issues from https://mirror.iad.rax.opendev.org/.
 >  Let's see if this was transitory.

The infra mirrors URLs were recently switched to HTTPS which doesnt work for ubuntu when the ca-certificates package is not present (chicken-egg situation with installing that of course). I've backported a patch to fix the URsL, lets see how far it gets with that."}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-13 21:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jobs are failing when trying to install tempest plugin dependencies.  Specifically, neutron-tempest-plugins pulls in setuptools 49.3.1 which fails because it does not support python 2.  44.x is the last release to support python 2.

Adding "setuptools===44.0.0;python_version=='2.7'" to the constraints file solves the problem.  To verify, I copied the current upper-constraints.txt for stable/rocky to a gist, pinned setuptools, and overrode tempest_upper_constraints_url in os_tempest as follows:

tempest_upper_constraints_url: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/cfarquhar/e885083e54a48904bfaff34984e67795/raw/c24d4c89c3dffa449ee533b4c382633061fe3827/upper-constraints.txt


The requirements project doesn't seem to accept direct patches to upper-constraints.txt (it's a generated file).  neutron-tempest-plugins does not support python 2 since tag 0.9.0.  I'm happy to submit a fix but I'm not sure where the appropriate place to do that is.  Any suggestions would be appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-08-14 10:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Jobs are failing when trying to install tempest plugin
 > dependencies.  Specifically, neutron-tempest-plugins pulls in
 > setuptools 49.3.1 which fails because it does not support python 2.
 >  44.x is the last release to support python 2.
 > 

Yes this is the root cause of the trouble.

Openstack-ansible carries a very small set of 'global pins' here https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/stable/rocky/global-requirement-pins.txt which are things that are for various reasons not constrained in the wider openstack requriements.  For Rocky these are used in the repo_build role for the normal service venvs, which is why we don't see this problem until we get to the tempest plugins. Those are installed 'out-of-band' of the repo_build process and it seems we do not apply the global-requirement-pins at that point.

If you're interested in helping fix this (which would be great if you can!) I think that the first thing to do is propose a backport of this https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/03405f8f7de59cc5cfaaa076692dd1a266fa46b1 to stable/rocky, and then we can use the contents of the variable venv_build_global_constraints to create an extra constraints file for the tempest plugin install. That should then control the version of setuptools as intended by global-requirement-pins."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-08-14 10:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rocky the version of neutron plugin has been pinned here https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/692266e0e7665eacd72e012b79420479b1d3014e

This *should* be fixed now, if the tests are still pulling in something newer than 0.9.0 let me know.'}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-19 13:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-19 14:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Jonathan!  I attempted the venv_build_global_constraints approach initially.  After some more digging, I think the approach in https://review.opendev.org/746928 will require less code changes and still solve the problem.  Please let me know if you disagree.'}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-19 16:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2020-08-21 14:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-01-13 17:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

rocky is extended-maintainance, abandoning'}]

commit_message:
Remove dragonflow ML2 driver

Dragonflow is no longer maintained as an OpenStack project [1]
and has therefore been removed from OpenStack-Ansible as a
supported ML2 driver for neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/613856

Related-Bug: 1890492

commit_message:
Simplify pre-gate tasks

Since CI images are more clean now, there's no reason in
packages removal anymore. However, we should use http repos
for Ubuntu, as there might be certificate issue.

Change-Id: I4614332a24316bf561c0466942f3a000035ca3b5

commit_message:
Remove neutron from tempest_plugins

Pulling the neutron repo into tempest is unnecessary since tests
are run using the neutron-tempest-plugin or repo-specific plugins.
This patch removes neutron from tempest_plugins.

(cherry picked from commit 78bb29230c4166faa8e84b563662d5d96ce6ec9d)
Change-Id: I6176c17b7261fecbca82452b7d4ad2a2c5cdeeb6

commit_message:
Pin virtualenv<20 for python2 functional tests

The functional tests break [1] wth versions of virtualenv 20 or greater
so pin the version on stable branches so that tests keep working.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798877/

Change-Id: Ie9c677933364afc9b3ea1821ee9f0d70589c5683
(cherry picked from commit 81f3860251a9cda01a5aee3baf40713e16d80c0e)

commit_message:
Update workspace tempest.conf on changes

When updating variables that would result in a modified
tempest.conf, the /root/.tempest/etc/tempest.conf or
/etc/tempest.conf would get updated properly.  A tempest
init happens after and does not copy those into an
existing workspace.  This change allows backup workspaces
to be kept on each modification to keep from loosing any
existing workspaces.

Change-Id: Id2de9cbd0f06b73dead5298afb857df2700bab60
Closes-Bug: #1763336
(cherry picked from commit 7654719383ad8a88db52e37564a8b9f9eaaca939)

commit_message:
Skip boostrap-ansible on upgrades if already run

Skips bootstrap-ansible on a rerun if it has already run
previously.

Moves the working directory creation to it's own function
so that the lock directory is created earlier.

Change-Id: I156e0143991c79cc2f664a98b6cd22353c01b55d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-06 11:43:20.000000000', 'message': "Letsencrypt remove suffix from path

The task fails if the suffix is specified in the path because the path
doesn't exists on the disk

The suffix is used only if an already configuration for that specific
host exists. By default, when letsencrypt is running for the first time
the tool automatically creates the path without any suffix.

Change-Id: I1d4c790000711b6ee3ff4d52dbe3eaf1b6a49b3e
"}]
commit_message:
Letsencrypt remove suffix from path

The task fails if the suffix is specified in the path because the path
doesn't exists on the disk

The suffix is used only if an already configuration for that specific
host exists. By default, when letsencrypt is running for the first time
the tool automatically creates the path without any suffix.

Change-Id: I1d4c790000711b6ee3ff4d52dbe3eaf1b6a49b3e

commit_message:
Replace unicode with six.text_type

The unicode() built-in does not exist under Python 3 so use
six.text_type, which is set correctly to str or unicode, instead.

Change-Id: Id593878e24046d697e654af6d99fec506148db93

commit_message:
Fix Ussuri requirements for Victoria grenade

Victoria grenade job is broken because diskimage-builder is missing
when deploying Ussuri.
A previous commit that fixed l-c and requirements incorrectly removed it
(Ia2b49128258b18653865622022e8877489f0087b)

Change-Id: I6ce224d3f5413f1ba1f9972576ec51a89d249886

commit_message:
Configure OVNCMSOptions=enable-chassis-as-gw within neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml

In order to configure OVN+SRIOV, the following THT files need to be
imported:
  - neutron-ovn-ha.yaml
  - neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml

Change-Id: Ia918d8b92d9bb1efac9bec2017b88593bf362834
Resolves: rhbz#1913700

commit_message:
Remove duplicated tasks to create persisitent directries for haproxy

We already have the task to create persistent directories for haproxy
in the HAProxyBase resource, so we don't need to define the same task
in haproxy-pacemaker-puppet.yaml.

Note that haproxy-pacemaker-puppet.yaml used to create /var/log/haproxy
but this is removed by this change because that directory is never
used.

Change-Id: I8a846317512ad068caa297821105023a71dc2183

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-22 09:58:30.000000000', 'message': 'Move fwaas jobs to the experimental queue

We have neutron-fwaas related jobs only for the stable/train and
stable/ussuri branches as neutron-fwaas was deprecated from stadium
after ussuri.
In both those cases those jobs are non-voting and broken - both are
failing 100% of the times now.
Based on that there is no point to waste infra resources and run those
jobs on every patch. Lets move them to the experimental queue so it can
be run on demand.

Change-Id: I4ea122e7ca1e1c0b5c00bd3397740510540a8ff9
'}]
commit_message:
Move fwaas jobs to the experimental queue

We have neutron-fwaas related jobs only for the stable/train and
stable/ussuri branches as neutron-fwaas was deprecated from stadium
after ussuri.
In both those cases those jobs are non-voting and broken - both are
failing 100% of the times now.
Based on that there is no point to waste infra resources and run those
jobs on every patch. Lets move them to the experimental queue so it can
be run on demand.

Change-Id: I4ea122e7ca1e1c0b5c00bd3397740510540a8ff9

commit_message:
Revert "remove py37"

This reverts commit 0072a2a4a2287c1256f3a61d0df115e0fed79070.

Reason for revert: Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8).

Change-Id: I18af556ea036747d4c6f04952d41ef0d9f7e2fc0

commit_message:
Add daxio package for nvdimm scenario

nova-compute uses daxio to cleanup vpmem backend device on instance
delete. If the daxio binary is missing in the nova-compute container
instance delete fails.

Change-Id: I74339687aad97bf63afc474f672cf969f4d9674c
Closes-Bug: 1907124

[{'created': '2021-01-13 08:06:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix dpdk deploy failed

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23
(cherry picked from commit b12be305cb82481b4fd8887fc803b59f845bb866)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dpdk deploy failed

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23
(cherry picked from commit b12be305cb82481b4fd8887fc803b59f845bb866)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 10:24:21.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

This project isn't released but uniformization can't hurt.

The origin of these changes was that we need to specify doc requirements
in doc/requirements.txt to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1]
for the release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt
file and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt
file to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new
pip resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in
error.

This project could meet similar conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I0101b340fef5ae465eb64e7d7b21973d36fd2a6a
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

This project isn't released but uniformization can't hurt.

The origin of these changes was that we need to specify doc requirements
in doc/requirements.txt to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1]
for the release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt
file and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt
file to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new
pip resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in
error.

This project could meet similar conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I0101b340fef5ae465eb64e7d7b21973d36fd2a6a

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

Move specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt to
doc/reqs.txt.

This project isn't released but uniformization can't hurt.

The origin of these changes was that we need to specify doc requirements
in doc/requirements.txt to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the
release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project could meet similar conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Id7375754cc62bb730af6513c0af17cedcbbedacf

This project isn't released but uniformization can't hurt.

The origin of these changes was that we need to specify doc requirements
in doc/requirements.txt to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1]
for the release team [2][3].  Removed specific doc requirements
from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

This project isn't released but uniformization can't hurt.

The origin of these changes was that we need to specify doc requirements
in doc/requirements.txt to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1]
for the release team [2][3].  Removed specific doc requirements
from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project could meet similar conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Ie0c8db6331630c5d3a379a9c8c2d87eb0a8fd207

commit_message:
molteniron does not make releases

This project was never supposed to have any releases,
it's a tool that was used by 3rd Party CI in Ironic.

Set the release-management key so that it gets properly
ignored by the release management team.

Change-Id: I707de0df26a69fdbcbf76078e9c8a6a86f1247f2

commit_message:
Fix 'requires_keypair' impact on NG Launch Instance dialog

Although Key Pair step at NG Launch Instance dialog automatically picks
a key pair, it's better to make key pair step as required explicitly when
'requires_keypair' is set to true in OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES.

Closes-Bug: #1765024

Change-Id: I28b0f54fed0dac86e300fb9ed65c16e0dd2aef36

subject: Fix dpdk deploy failed
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-13 08:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-13 08:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-13 08:17:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix dpdk deploy failed

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23
(cherry picked from commit b12be305cb82481b4fd8887fc803b59f845bb866)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dpdk deploy failed

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23
(cherry picked from commit b12be305cb82481b4fd8887fc803b59f845bb866)

commit_message:
Add SSHExecCommandFailed to be handled in the fip_pf_connectivity

While checking FIP port forwarding connectivity, we were expecting
that errors like AssertionError or SSHTimeout may happen but
it seems that sometimes in tests it may also happen that
SSHExecCommandFailed if raised, due to e.g. -1 returned by "hostname"
command executed on the guest vm.
Instead of immediatelly failing test in such case, lets handle that
one properly too and retry check of hostname.

Change-Id: Ic525d3f548cea7f3c671bf7f1c0eded125e8a7bc

repository as an additional tool on top of the main tripleo CLI.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-13 11:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix different issues to ublock CI

The recent version of unittests discovered several issues:

* Context manager should be used while reading files
  to ensure that file descriptors are closed at the right time.

* wrong test data at test_consume_results_sla_failure_abort. the number
  add_iteration execution should not be less that number of iteration
  results.

Change-Id: Ibd79f0c444a8cffcca0349b80aab79cd4c115158
'}]
commit_message:
Fix different issues to ublock CI

The recent version of unittests discovered several issues:

* Context manager should be used while reading files
  to ensure that file descriptors are closed at the right time.

* wrong test data at test_consume_results_sla_failure_abort. the number
  add_iteration execution should not be less that number of iteration
  results.

Change-Id: Ibd79f0c444a8cffcca0349b80aab79cd4c115158

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: Iced1c0986f448b2a19b1f81586e50a039c23f566

commit_message:
Add ability to specify memcached port

The port defaults to hiera('memcached_authtoken_port', 11211)
for authtoken middleware and hiera('memcached_port', 11211)
for other uses. Different ports might be set for security
and performance tuning.

Change-Id: I567d6b2cd66d5eb98971cd54987c1fbea3c1da78

commit_message:
Move the misplaced release note file

This change moves the release note file which was added to the wrong
place[1].

Note that this file was added during this cycle so we can move it to
reno directory so that the note is added to the current release note.

[1] cb982440d74731e4943b75ea51feaa4f0fdcb938

Change-Id: I3ded156dfc0c954ee862ddf98f7d97a672f347f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-10 15:55:53.000000000', 'message': "ovn: Change dvr env file to non-dvr

DVR is a default in OVN. Previously we had a dvr environment file, that
overrode the default True to explicit True. The other environment file
that doesn't specify DVR left the default True but removed the bridge
mappings from compute nodes leading to a state where Neutron server was
configured DVR but compute nodes were not. The environment files are
confusing this way.

This patch changes the DVR environment file to non-dvr, explicitly
disabling DVR. And leaves the environment files that don't specify DVR
in their names to defautl behavior.

Closes-bug: #1889222

Change-Id: Iecd5ff6023c68daca0629e6f516e5b7f2118833e
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-09-09 08:13:35.000000000', 'message': "ovn: Change dvr env file to non-dvr

DVR is a default in OVN. Previously we had a dvr environment file, that
overrode the default True to explicit True. The other environment file
that doesn't specify DVR left the default True but removed the bridge
mappings from compute nodes leading to a state where Neutron server was
configured DVR but compute nodes were not. The environment files are
confusing this way.

commit_message:
ovn: Change dvr env file to non-dvr

DVR is a default in OVN. Previously we had a dvr environment file, that
overrode the default True to explicit True. The other environment file
that doesn't specify DVR left the default True but removed the bridge
mappings from compute nodes leading to a state where Neutron server was
configured DVR but compute nodes were not. The environment files are
confusing this way and thus patch removes the bridge mappings from the
file.

This patch changes the DVR environment file to non-dvr, explicitly
disabling DVR. And leaves the environment files that don't specify DVR
in their names to defautl behavior.

Closes-bug: #1889222

Change-Id: Iecd5ff6023c68daca0629e6f516e5b7f2118833e
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix wrong file names of some unit test files

Unit test files should be named like *_spec.rb otherwise these files
are ignored. This change fixes wrong file names assigned to some test
files so that all tests are executed as expected.

Change-Id: Iaa248f90cfa693f365db3df50a5b67f72c74cc51

commit_message:
Process requests for radosgw per unit keys

Process requests for radosgw per unit keys. Ideally the charm
would move to using charms.ceph.utils for the get_radosgw_key
method but this does not work atm. I have raised bug #1899643
to cover deduplicating hooks.ceph v charms.ceph.*

Change-Id: I00f5a58f127baa1f7878b0ddb31b4fa009d9651e
Closes-Bug: #1899634

subject: Replace run_tempest with use_os_tempest
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-13 10:35:46.000000000', 'message': 'Replace run_tempest with use_os_tempest

The variable run_tempest was used by validate-tempest. Since we are no
longer running jobs with validate-tempest but with os_tempest, replacing
where run_tempest is set to false, since these featuresets are supposed
to not run tempest.
Also removing test_ping variable, since test ping is no longer
available.

Change-Id: I0651150208b3cb8b3fc56661af46957dba097151
'}]
commit_message:
Replace run_tempest with use_os_tempest

The variable run_tempest was used by validate-tempest. Since we are no
longer running jobs with validate-tempest but with os_tempest, replacing
where run_tempest is set to false, since these featuresets are supposed
to not run tempest.
Also removing test_ping variable, since test ping is no longer
available.

Change-Id: I0651150208b3cb8b3fc56661af46957dba097151

commit_message:
ovn: Support live migration to DPDK nodes

Previously, the vif-plugged event was emitted only when port VIF type
was set to normal. In DPDK case, the type is vhostuser. This patch
matches the type too and emits the notification to Nova.

Closes-bug: #1910213

Co-Authored-By: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7b12a469ae7197028cf3695520084597f4256480

[{'created': '2021-01-11 12:37:40.000000000', 'message': 'CI: revert to public package mirrors after build

When building images in CI, we use local package mirrors to reduce
external network traffic. These mirrors are not necessarily reliable nor
are they guaranteed to be accessible outside of the CI environment
(although many are).

While it is an antipattern to install packages in containers at runtime,
the Bifrost container does just that. If the mirrors configured in the
image are unavailable, Bifrost deployment can fail.

This change fixes the issue by reverting to public package mirrors as a
final step of the image build process.

Closes-Bug: #1902101

commit_message:
CI: revert to public package mirrors after build

When building images in CI, we use local package mirrors to reduce
external network traffic. These mirrors are not necessarily reliable nor
are they guaranteed to be accessible outside of the CI environment
(although many are).

While it is an antipattern to install packages in containers at runtime,
the Bifrost container does just that. If the mirrors configured in the
image are unavailable, Bifrost deployment can fail.

This change fixes the issue by reverting to public package mirrors as a
final step of the image build process.

Closes-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe
(cherry picked from commit 0fc464332c789ce05e9d6442726ada84ce7fc65a)

commit_message:
Remove footer block from intermediate images

Only the final image in a hierarchy should have the footer block.

neutron-infoblox-ipam-agent image still has two footers because it
inherits from the neutron-server image. We set the user to root at the
beginning of that Dockerfile, so that headers and footers have the right
context.

Change-Id: I95e5bb5583be2a76e289749e8adfc303a4e7197a
(cherry picked from commit 4b792b9a43bee3bfb499cea14924527550f2bce0)

Hey,

I'm coming very late for this, but imho, I think having a hardcoded path in that case is wrong. We should write a path in regard of the execution id.
If it's doesn't work as it was, it's a bug, but we should not forced this path.

Since mistral has been removed for this part, this is probably not a big issue atm.. but in case of we still have some issue, I think it will be better to fix the bug instead of workaround it like that."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-01-13 10:20:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If it's doesn't work as it was, it's a bug, but we should not forced this path.
> 
> Since mistral has been removed for this part, this is probably not a big issue atm.. but in case of we still have some issue, I think it will be better to fix the bug instead of workaround it like that.

Yes, now that mistral is out of the equation it makes more sense to move the package_update.log file to the place where the config_download playbooks are located."}]

subject: Add doc/requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 12:50:26.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.
The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Id02023188eb0f6ecd89bec471407caacc71b92cd
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.
The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Id02023188eb0f6ecd89bec471407caacc71b92cd

commit_message:
Disable selinux defaults enforcement in File/Concat resources

Last selinux-policy in CentOS Stream adds patch for [1] which modifies
default context for symlinks under /etc/httpd. That's breaking
idempotency for files created with File/Concat resources under that directory
because of [2].

This patch is disabling default selinux context enforcement for all
File/Concat resources until we have a fix for [2].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1900650
[2] https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-7559

Conflicts:
  fixtures/scenario001.pp
  fixtures/scenario004.pp

Change-Id: Ic92889cc480c316df9454186ffadf3a77fd8ed26
(cherry picked from commit 0f00dde75739314270c493528b2160bb80e60ca2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 16:21:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add a storm-base image

Refactor storm image dependencies. Previously we had:

base -> storm -> monasca-thresh

Both storm and monasca-thresh images are final, and each includes a
footer. This causes issues when the footer expects to be at the end of
the image, or there to be only a single footer. In particular, since
I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe, the footer used in CI jobs
reverts to the public package mirrors.

This change introduces a storm-base image, and refactors the dependency
chain:

base -> storm-base -> storm
base -> storm-base -> monasca-thresh

Related-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I53e8ba8d4baa4434cf3c49ed94d1f7cb44099bee
'}]
commit_message:
Add a storm-base image

Refactor storm image dependencies. Previously we had:

base -> storm -> monasca-thresh

Both storm and monasca-thresh images are final, and each includes a
footer. This causes issues when the footer expects to be at the end of
the image, or there to be only a single footer. In particular, since
I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe, the footer used in CI jobs
reverts to the public package mirrors.

This change introduces a storm-base image, and refactors the dependency
chain:

base -> storm-base -> storm
base -> storm-base -> monasca-thresh

Related-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I53e8ba8d4baa4434cf3c49ed94d1f7cb44099bee

commit_message:
api: drop project_id from kwargs in client

The client will use the admin_token auth_type if an endpoint and token
are provided, this auth_type does not support getting a project_id so it
will raise an error in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I76c9f19bb11c9d5a92a06e3b7c8b70b7c3a035e5
(cherry picked from commit 50134dc769a666b29ba55e377d7b1bfc4af94489)

subject: Fix remove libvirt apparmor disabled profile
messages:
[{'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2021-01-02 19:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2021-01-04 21:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug,

can you help me to take a look this change?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-05 09:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks sensible to me. Could you add a release note?'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2021-01-05 10:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Agree, looks fine, will wait for release note.'}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2021-01-08 18:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-11 09:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2021-01-11 11:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32761, 'date': '2021-01-12 11:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-01-12 12:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

-1 -- There is one case where this would fail the logic - user disables the profile but has not yet removed it (and we don't remove it either now). I also wonder if Ubuntu with apparmor is currently happy with reboots as we don't disable the profile but merely remove it from kernel's runtime.
Another point is this should really be symmetric to chrony's situation (and we should really drop containerising chrony)."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> -1 -- There is one case where this would fail the logic - user disables the profile but has not yet removed it (and we don't remove it either now). I also wonder if Ubuntu with apparmor is currently happy with reboots as we don't disable the profile but merely remove it from kernel's runtime.
> Another point is this should really be symmetric to chrony's situation (and we should really drop containerising chrony).

The case you describe sounds a lot like the original bug report?

The task to remove the Libvirt AppArmor profile[1] doesn't consider the case where the profile exists but is disabled. That scenario raises the following error:

TASK [baremetal : Remove apparmor profile for libvirt] ******************************************************************************************************
fatal: [rasp4-node03]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": ["apparmor_parser", "-R", "/etc/apparmor.d/usr.sbin.libvirtd"], "delta": "0:00:00.213067", "end": "2020-02-03 19:48:34.486978", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 254, "start": "2020-02-03 19:48:34.273911", "stderr": "apparmor_parser: Unable to remove \"/usr/sbin/libvirtd\". Profile doesn't exist", "stderr_lines": ["apparmor_parser: Unable to remove \"/usr/sbin/libvirtd\". Profile doesn't exist"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > -1 -- There is one case where this would fail the logic - user disables the profile but has not yet removed it (and we don't remove it either now). I also wonder if Ubuntu with apparmor is currently happy with reboots as we don't disable the profile but merely remove it from kernel's runtime.
> > Another point is this should really be symmetric to chrony's situation (and we should really drop containerising chrony).
> 
> The case you describe sounds a lot like the original bug report?
> 
> The task to remove the Libvirt AppArmor profile[1] doesn't consider the case where the profile exists but is disabled. That scenario raises the following error:
> 
> TASK [baremetal : Remove apparmor profile for libvirt] ******************************************************************************************************
> fatal: [rasp4-node03]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": ["apparmor_parser", "-R", "/etc/apparmor.d/usr.sbin.libvirtd"], "delta": "0:00:00.213067", "end": "2020-02-03 19:48:34.486978", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 254, "start": "2020-02-03 19:48:34.273911", "stderr": "apparmor_parser: Unable to remove \"/usr/sbin/libvirtd\". Profile doesn't exist", "stderr_lines": ["apparmor_parser: Unable to remove \"/usr/sbin/libvirtd\". Profile doesn't exist"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

Yup, my point is the fix is in the right direction but incomplete. You can disable a profile and forget to remove it. This is operator's mistake but nonetheless something we don't handle in here.'}]

commit_message:
Fix remove libvirt apparmor disabled profile

The bootstrap process tries to removes existing apparmor profiles but
doesn't consider the case where those are disabled. This change fixes
the scenario where the libvirt profile exists but is disabled.

Closes-Bug: 1909874

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ia71dc29dedb6786c4df4546bb4e7df6956966ec0

As expected, if we merge this patch as it is it will break the upstream CI upgrades job, as the virt:8.2 stream is a downstream thing only:

2020-12-09 15:01:39 | 2020-12-09 15:01:39.097189 | bc764e04-5610-d46d-4fd6-0000000001d2 |    CHANGED | Run UpgradeInitCommonCommand | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131913

2020-12-09 15:01:39 | 2020-12-09 15:01:39.099426 | bc764e04-5610-d46d-4fd6-0000000001d2 |     TIMING | Run UpgradeInitCommonCommand | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131913 | 0:00:28.856717 | 0.29s

2020-12-09 15:01:39 | 2020-12-09 15:01:39.160851 | bc764e04-5610-d46d-4fd6-0000000001d3 |       TASK | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream

2020-12-09 15:02:07 | 2020-12-09 15:02:07.121643 | bc764e04-5610-d46d-4fd6-0000000001d3 |     TIMING | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131913 | 0:00:56.878919 | 27.96s

2020-12-09 15:02:09 | 2020-12-09 15:02:09.087497 | bc764e04-5610-d46d-4fd6-0000000001d3 |      FATAL | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131913 | item={'module': 'virt', 'stream': '8.2'} | error={"ansible_loop_var": "item", "changed": false, "item": {"module": "virt", "stream": "8.2"}, "msg": "No group virt:8.2/common available.", "results": []}

So, the solution for this is to merge upstream this patch including only container-tools:2.0 for the overcloud nodes but when backporting it downstream add virt:8.2.

I did test the patch dowsntream and it worked like a charm in the minor update and FFU workflows. I will -1 until updating the list of streams enabled for the overcloud nodes. Something insteresting is that for the minor update the steps where skipped:

2020-12-09 14:58:48 | 2020-12-09 14:58:48.551120 | bc764e04-3fb2-81d3-3cc2-000000000024 |     TIMING | Enforce RHOSP rules regarding subscription. | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131857 | 0:00:21.291276 | 0.04s

2020-12-09 14:58:48 | 2020-12-09 14:58:48.604107 | bc764e04-3fb2-81d3-3cc2-000000000025 |       TASK | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream

2020-12-09 14:58:48 | 2020-12-09 14:58:48.641079 | bc764e04-3fb2-81d3-3cc2-000000000025 |    SKIPPED | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131857 | item={'module': 'container-tools', 'stream': '2.0'}

2020-12-09 14:58:48 | 2020-12-09 14:58:48.654052 | bc764e04-3fb2-81d3-3cc2-000000000025 |    SKIPPED | Ensure DNF modules have the right stream | centos-8-rax-dfw-0022131857 | item={'module': 'virt', 'stream': '8.2'}

I will need to dig into it..'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-12-16 09:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-12-16 10:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-12-16 10:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-06 20:05:48.000000000', 'message': "Invoke tripleo-stream-enable for Upgrades and Updates.

To ensure we get the right package versions we need to
make sure the right stream is configured for the
container-tools module.

This patch leverages the tripleo-stream-enable role, which
allows us to enable a stream for some specific module and
configures in upadtes/upgrades task for step0 the stream
passed in ContainerToolsStream heat parameter. If the stream
passed in such parameter is alredy set, then the role won't
do anything else. On the contrary, it will disable the current
stream, enable the one from ContainerToolsStream and run
distro-sync to synchronize the content.

Depends-On: I36cb46f6eae8c8e55dca1d165d57119bea897a81
Change-Id: Ib388af0a06bbb6172593dc2fd19748b770b2e335
Closes-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

"}, {'created': '2020-09-01 16:04:47.000000000', 'message': "Set up right DNF module stream for Upgrades and Updates.

To ensure we get the right package versions we need to
make sure the right stream is configured for the
container-tools module.

This patch leverages the dnf module, which when passing as name
the @ identifier allows us to enable a stream for some specific
module [0], configuring the stream passed in DnfStreams heat parameter
in updates/upgrades task for step0.

If the stream passed in such parameter is alredy set, then the
module won't do anything else. On the contrary, it will disable
the current stream, enable the ones from DnfStreams and synchronize
the content.

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/dnf_module.html#examples
Closes-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

Change-Id: Ib388af0a06bbb6172593dc2fd19748b770b2e335

"}, {'created': '2020-11-24 16:35:34.000000000', 'message': "Set up right DNF module stream for Upgrades and Updates.

To ensure we get the right package versions we need to
make sure the right stream is configured for the
container-tools module.

This patch leverages the dnf module, which when passing as name
the @ identifier allows us to enable a stream for some specific
module [0], configuring the stream passed in DnfStreams heat parameter
in updates/upgrades task for step0.

If the stream passed in such parameter is alredy set, then the
module won't do anything else. On the contrary, it will disable
the current stream, enable the ones from DnfStreams and synchronize
the content.

By default the new Heat parameter defaults to empty list and it is
in the environment files where we set the right values depending
on the operation to perform (undercloud upgrade, overcloud update
or overcloud upgrade).

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/dnf_module.html#examples
Closes-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

Change-Id: Ib388af0a06bbb6172593dc2fd19748b770b2e335

make sure the right stream is configured for the
container-tools module.

This patch leverages the dnf module, which when passing as name
the @ identifier allows us to enable a stream for some specific
module [0], configuring the stream passed in DnfStreams heat parameter
in updates/upgrades task for step0.

If the stream passed in such parameter is alredy set, then the
module won't do anything else. On the contrary, it will disable
the current stream, enable the ones from DnfStreams and synchronize
the content.

By default the new Heat parameter defaults to empty list and it is
in the environment files where we set the right values depending
on the operation to perform (undercloud upgrade, overcloud update
or overcloud upgrade).

commit_message:
Set up right DNF module stream for Upgrades and Updates.

To ensure we get the right package versions we need to
make sure the right stream is configured for the
container-tools module.

This patch leverages the dnf module, which when passing as name
the @ identifier allows us to enable a stream for some specific
module [0], configuring the stream passed in DnfStreams heat parameter
in updates/upgrades task for step0.

If the stream passed in such parameter is alredy set, then the
module won't do anything else. On the contrary, it will disable
the current stream, enable the ones from DnfStreams and synchronize
the content.

By default the new Heat parameter defaults to empty list and it is
in the environment files where we set the right values depending
on the operation to perform (undercloud upgrade, overcloud update
or overcloud upgrade).

*****************************************************************
*BACKPORT NOTE: Add DNF module stream virt:8.2 in the overcloud *
*upgrade/update environment files.                              *
*****************************************************************

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/dnf_module.html#examples
Closes-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

Change-Id: Ib388af0a06bbb6172593dc2fd19748b770b2e335

Closes-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe
'}, {'created': '2020-11-17 11:42:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: CI: revert to public package mirrors after build

When building images in CI, we use local package mirrors to reduce
external network traffic. These mirrors are not necessarily reliable nor
are they guaranteed to be accessible outside of the CI environment
(although many are).

While it is an antipattern to install packages in containers at runtime,
the Bifrost container does just that. If the mirrors configured in the
image are unavailable, Bifrost deployment can fail.

This change fixes the issue by reverting to public package mirrors as a
final step of the image build process.

Closes-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe
'}, {'created': '2020-11-17 14:42:21.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: CI: revert to public package mirrors after build

Closes-Bug: #1902101

are they guaranteed to be accessible outside of the CI environment

the Bifrost container does just that. If the mirrors configured in the
image are unavailable, Bifrost deployment can fail.

commit_message:
CI: revert to public package mirrors after build

When building images in CI, we use local package mirrors to reduce
external network traffic. These mirrors are not necessarily reliable nor
are they guaranteed to be accessible outside of the CI environment
(although many are).

While it is an antipattern to install packages in containers at runtime,
the Bifrost container does just that. If the mirrors configured in the
image are unavailable, Bifrost deployment can fail.

This change fixes the issue by reverting to public package mirrors as a
final step of the image build process.

Closes-Bug: #1902101

Change-Id: I2592a736206eaec811290e9fbdbf2540c0518ffe

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ie0678a020707e1d906f487c709d64447d1eee905

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dpdk deploy failed

This change fix ansible deploy ovs-dpdk failed and
neutron_openvswitch_agent container can't start..

dpdk_tunnel is a role variable, but kolla_address gets vaule
from hostvars. so we need remove this variable and it's friends
to group/all.yaml

neutron_openvswitch_agent connects to ovs-db with 127.0.0.1,
but ovs-db listen on management interface.

Closes-Bug: 1908850

Change-Id: I86a13d2476644bfa2545a6737752cda1ade34d23

commit_message:
Glance: use the puppet parameter to enable image cache feature

This change migrates the logic to include the required classes for
image cache feature from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo, so
that we compose all required puppet classes in puppet-tripleo.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/768796
Change-Id: I6fa9146746539e60b8ca08adadd839aa8c21fa4a

commit_message:
Add setting to override max memcached connections

Added MemcachedMaxConnections to allow max connection override as
actually the limit is 8192 connections but in some cases the environment
will create more than 8192 connections to each memcached server.

commit_message:
Glance: Include the required classes for image cache

This change is a prep work to migrate class composition for image cache
feature from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo, so that we can
gather all logics to compose required puppet classes in puppet-tripleo.

Change-Id: I843d72542154a2e278ba257f6b61ed573c7c3860

commit_message:
Obsolete check-identity-04

The [token]/hash_algorithm config option has been deprecated since
mitaka[1].

To avoid renumbering, update check-identity-04 to '(Obsolete)'. This
keeps numbering compatibilty for people using previous version of the
checklist.

[1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/deprecated-as-of-mitaka

Change-Id: I587617f29141a244ca7983300ff4fcebed4255f5

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I5645f2f8d9d2a2444f1e2c5ca0d04f024c293a0a

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I5f86837c601eb64dff3c370decd2670f2a6276b6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pass custom args to create_port through create_server

Allow consumers of create_server to pass custom arguments to
create_port method which is called from create_server one.

Fix namestart var usage in create_port - as the name of the var
suggests, it should be used to generate a name from. Therefore
the patch also adds rand_name call which we accidentaly removed
recently.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: I724e0f37d4381a493217a077492046f7a4b0a2a2

commit_message:
Use proper kwargs in rebuild_server

Use proper kwargs arg instead of the named arg in rebuild_server.
The method is not used anywhere with the rebuild_kwargs set so this
change should affect anybody.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: Id445d3f1daee4dec1f771580667a35baffa18e62

commit_message:
Add parameter to set image_type_exclude_list

Add support for the [compute]/image_type_exclude_list parameter to
prevent image types being reported as supported by a compute node.

Related nova change: Iabe6246dba212b1a287a82cc0cf16e2e8c8a24b8

Change-Id: I389d4b586468720d73ac69b025a3c34df54fe73e

commit_message:
Add debug helper script

I'm not sure if others will find this useful, but I use this
script to run pieces of devstack while trying to write/debug
things. It saves me a lot of time being able to get to some
project-lib function without a full clean/re-stack.

Figured I'd share in case it's worth putting into the tree.

Change-Id: Iad500bebff7740ef4821ed565fab9210e6f68ab2

on a non-privileged account for the host no longer works. We need to run
the registry as root in order for it to properly bind 5000.  This will

commit_message:
Fix tripleo_podman molecule jobs

In order to launch the container and connect via networking, we need
selinux disabled for a rootless container to still work. Let's move the
selinux disabling to first rather than later.

Change-Id: I345e8b8547b81e5791656d0fca6e90b1de48fdac

commit_message:
Setting available_features for stable branch

available_features for Neutron tempest tests is default to "all" and
used from Victoria to enable/disable tests that has no API extension.
It is added here to make sure that stable gating will not execute these
tests (like for IPv6 metadata in neutron-tempest-plugin or updating
min_bw QoS values for port already attached to VMs)

Cherry-picked from stable/victoria patch
(https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/769885), but the list
for available_features is empty on Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic6056218e51e6b0da554bcdf139214d2229ba3c1
Related-Bug: #1882804
(cherry picked from commit e34a8720bfb263a0b4d585929ef9f035c3ba0f36)

commit_message:
Expand roles honstname to role mapping

Expand roles is extended to return a hostname
to role mapping for all instanced. this map is
used to set the 'triple_role=$ROLE_NAME' tag
on ports.

The intent is to use these this tag in
conjunction with the pre-existing tags and
neutron network port information to set up the
in the tripleo-common code utilized by
tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Change-Id: I992d7a3cd946e42039ca0819c51f104b1231171b

subject: Comparison exception causes quota output to fail
messages: [{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-01-12 22:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-01-12 22:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 22:12:42.000000000', 'message': 'Comparison exception causes quota output to fail

The key/value pairs being checked include the quota's id, and the value
is a UUID. Being that this is the only key where the value is not an
integer, this causes issues with Python 3's rules for comparisons
between different types. This manifests as a "Failed to list quota
sizes." error when viewing a region's quota information. This patch
will catch this exception and allow it to continue as before, without
modifying the value.

I opted for this method instead of just skipping 'id' at the start of
the loop since this is closer to the original behavior, and there is
already an explicit check for 'id' at the bottom before adding to the
output. This way, any future keys that also have non-int values will
be handled gracefully as well.

Change-Id: Ib0e53572bfc8600094a6f8483e26bf2d0023ce80
(cherry picked from commit 9c5660acbb19a2a0433ace76612cbe996a5dfe09)
'}]
commit_message:
Comparison exception causes quota output to fail

The key/value pairs being checked include the quota's id, and the value
is a UUID. Being that this is the only key where the value is not an
integer, this causes issues with Python 3's rules for comparisons
between different types. This manifests as a "Failed to list quota
sizes." error when viewing a region's quota information. This patch
will catch this exception and allow it to continue as before, without
modifying the value.

I opted for this method instead of just skipping 'id' at the start of
the loop since this is closer to the original behavior, and there is
already an explicit check for 'id' at the bottom before adding to the
output. This way, any future keys that also have non-int values will
be handled gracefully as well.

Change-Id: Ib0e53572bfc8600094a6f8483e26bf2d0023ce80
(cherry picked from commit 9c5660acbb19a2a0433ace76612cbe996a5dfe09)

     which contains a link to check the progress of the request.
204: The server has fulfilled the request.

commit_message:
Set lower-constraints job to non-voting

While we figure out the issue with our
requirements files, let's prevent the failing
job from blocking unrelated changes to merge.

Change-Id: I3a199024ddcf70dadf0a5ac4d7012d58ca82758f
Related-Bug: #1911071
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ic4b699a80fa5b118ccd4515037031c0109cb9d12
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Comparison exception causes quota output to fail
messages: [{'account_id': 32802, 'date': '2021-01-12 13:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-01-12 21:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nty!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 13:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'Comparison exception causes quota output to fail

The key/value pairs being checked include the quota's id, and the value
is a UUID. Being that this is the only key where the value is not an
integer, this causes issues with Python 3's rules for comparisons
between different types. This manifests as a "Failed to list quota
sizes." error when viewing a region's quota information. This patch
will catch this exception and allow it to continue as before, without
modifying the value.

I opted for this method instead of just skipping 'id' at the start of
the loop since this is closer to the original behavior, and there is
already an explicit check for 'id' at the bottom before adding to the
output. This way, any future keys that also have non-int values will
be handled gracefully as well.

Change-Id: Ib0e53572bfc8600094a6f8483e26bf2d0023ce80
'}]
commit_message:
Comparison exception causes quota output to fail

The key/value pairs being checked include the quota's id, and the value
is a UUID. Being that this is the only key where the value is not an
integer, this causes issues with Python 3's rules for comparisons
between different types. This manifests as a "Failed to list quota
sizes." error when viewing a region's quota information. This patch
will catch this exception and allow it to continue as before, without
modifying the value.

I opted for this method instead of just skipping 'id' at the start of
the loop since this is closer to the original behavior, and there is
already an explicit check for 'id' at the bottom before adding to the
output. This way, any future keys that also have non-int values will
be handled gracefully as well.

Change-Id: Ib0e53572bfc8600094a6f8483e26bf2d0023ce80

subject: Fixed typos in nova and neutron quota output
messages: [{'account_id': 32802, 'date': '2021-01-12 13:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-01-12 21:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nty!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 13:11:27.000000000', 'message': "Fixed typos in nova and neutron quota output

The Nova and Neutron quota helper objects output the quota data with
the word 'secuirty' instead of 'security' in the key name. Adjutant-ui,
nova and neutron (among others) look for the keys with the correct
spelling. No other instance of the typo appears to exist in other
modules.

APIImpact: some keys returned by Adjutant are now correctly spelled
Change-Id: Idf2953027765119d70720592ccc1187472854fad
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed typos in nova and neutron quota output

The Nova and Neutron quota helper objects output the quota data with
the word 'secuirty' instead of 'security' in the key name. Adjutant-ui,
nova and neutron (among others) look for the keys with the correct
spelling. No other instance of the typo appears to exist in other
modules.

APIImpact: some keys returned by Adjutant are now correctly spelled
Change-Id: Idf2953027765119d70720592ccc1187472854fad
